6362 return mapFromScene(path);
6363}
6364
6365/*!
6366 Maps the path \a path, which is in this item's parent's coordinate
6367 system, to this item's coordinate system, and returns the mapped path.
6368
6369 \sa mapFromScene(), mapFromItem(), mapToParent(), {The Graphics View
6370 Coordinate System}
6371*/
6372QPainterPath QGraphicsItem::mapFromParent(const QPainterPath &path) const
6373{
6374 // COMBINE
6375 if (!d_ptr->transformData)
6376 return path.translated(offset: -d_ptr->pos);
6377 return d_ptr->transformToParent().inverted().map(p: path);
6378}
6379
6380/*!
6381 Maps the path \a path, which is in this item's scene's coordinate
6382 system, to this item's coordinate system, and returns the mapped path.
6383
6384 \sa mapFromParent(), mapFromItem(), mapToScene(), {The Graphics View
6385 Coordinate System}
6386*/
6387QPainterPath QGraphicsItem::mapFromScene(const QPainterPath &path) const
6388{
6389 if (d_ptr->hasTranslateOnlySceneTransform())
6390 return path.translated(dx: -d_ptr->sceneTransform.dx(), dy: -d_ptr->sceneTransform.dy());
6391 return d_ptr->sceneTransform.inverted().map(p: path);
6392}
6393
6394/*!
6395 Returns \c true if this item is an ancestor of \a child (i.e., if this item
6396 is \a child's parent, or one of \a child's parent's ancestors).
6397
6398 \sa parentItem()
6399*/
6400bool QGraphicsItem::isAncestorOf(const QGraphicsItem *child) const
6401{
6402 if (!child || child == this)
6403 return false;
6404 if (child->d_ptr->depth() < d_ptr->depth())
6405 return false;
6406 const QGraphicsItem *ancestor = child;
6407 while ((ancestor = ancestor->d_ptr->parent)) {
6408 if (ancestor == this)
6409 return true;
6410 }
6411 return false;
6412}
6413
6414/*!
6415 \since 4.4
6416
6417 Returns the closest common ancestor item of this item and \a other,
6418 or \nullptr if either \a other is \nullptr, or there is no common ancestor.
6419
6420 \sa isAncestorOf()
6421*/
6422QGraphicsItem *QGraphicsItem::commonAncestorItem(const QGraphicsItem *other) const
6423{
6424 if (!other)
6425 return nullptr;
6426 if (other == this)
6427 return const_cast<QGraphicsItem *>(this);
6428 const QGraphicsItem *thisw = this;
6429 const QGraphicsItem *otherw = other;
6430 int thisDepth = d_ptr->depth();
6431 int otherDepth = other->d_ptr->depth();
6432 while (thisDepth > otherDepth) {
6433 thisw = thisw->d_ptr->parent;
6434 --thisDepth;
6435 }
6436 while (otherDepth > thisDepth) {
6437 otherw = otherw->d_ptr->parent;
6438 --otherDepth;
6439 }
6440 while (thisw && thisw != otherw) {
6441 thisw = thisw->d_ptr->parent;
6442 otherw = otherw->d_ptr->parent;
6443 }
6444 return const_cast<QGraphicsItem *>(thisw);
6445}
6446
6447/*!
6448 \since 4.4
6449 Returns \c true if this item is currently under the mouse cursor in one of
6450 the views; otherwise, false is returned.
6451
6452 \sa QGraphicsScene::views(), QCursor::pos()
6453*/
6454bool QGraphicsItem::isUnderMouse() const
6455{
6456 Q_D(const QGraphicsItem);
6457 if (!d->scene)
6458 return false;
6459
6460 QPoint cursorPos = QCursor::pos();
6461 const auto views = d->scene->views();
6462 for (QGraphicsView *view : views) {
6463 if (contains(point: mapFromScene(point: view->mapToScene(point: view->mapFromGlobal(cursorPos)))))
6464 return true;
6465 }
6466 return false;
6467}
6468
6469/*!
6470 Returns this item's custom data for the key \a key as a QVariant.
6471
6472 Custom item data is useful for storing arbitrary properties in any
6473 item. Example:
6474
6475 \snippet code/src_gui_graphicsview_qgraphicsitem.cpp 11
6476
6477 Qt does not use this feature for storing data; it is provided solely
6478 for the convenience of the user.
6479
6480 \sa setData()
6481*/
6482QVariant QGraphicsItem::data(int key) const
6483{
6484 QGraphicsItemCustomDataStore *store = qt_dataStore();
6485 if (!store->data.contains(key: this))
6486 return QVariant();
6487 return store->data.value(key: this).value(key);
6488}
6489
6490/*!
6491 Sets this item's custom data for the key \a key to \a value.
6492
6493 Custom item data is useful for storing arbitrary properties for any
6494 item. Qt does not use this feature for storing data; it is provided solely
6495 for the convenience of the user.
6496
6497 \sa data()
6498*/
6499void QGraphicsItem::setData(int key, const QVariant &value)
6500{
6501 qt_dataStore()->data[this][key] = value;
6502}
6503
6504/*!
6505 \fn T qgraphicsitem_cast(QGraphicsItem *item)
6506 \relates QGraphicsItem
6507 \since 4.2
6508
6509 Returns the given \a item cast to type T if \a item is of type T;
6510 otherwise, \nullptr is returned.
6511
6512 \note To make this function work correctly with custom items, reimplement
6513 the \l{QGraphicsItem::}{type()} function for each custom QGraphicsItem
6514 subclass.
6515
6516 \sa QGraphicsItem::type(), QGraphicsItem::UserType
6517*/
6518
6519/*!
6520 Returns the type of an item as an int. All standard graphicsitem classes
6521 are associated with a unique value; see QGraphicsItem::Type. This type
6522 information is used by qgraphicsitem_cast() to distinguish between types.
6523
6524 The default implementation (in QGraphicsItem) returns UserType.
6525
6526 To enable use of qgraphicsitem_cast() with a custom item, reimplement this
6527 function and declare a Type enum value equal to your custom item's type.
6528 Custom items must return a value larger than or equal to UserType (65536).
6529
6530 For example:
6531
6532 \snippet code/src_gui_graphicsview_qgraphicsitem.cpp 1
6533
6534 \sa UserType
6535*/
6536int QGraphicsItem::type() const
6537{
6538 return (int)UserType;
6539}
6540
6541/*!
6542 Installs an event filter for this item on \a filterItem, causing
6543 all events for this item to first pass through \a filterItem's
6544 sceneEventFilter() function.
6545
6546 To filter another item's events, install this item as an event filter
6547 for the other item. Example:
6548
6549 \snippet code/src_gui_graphicsview_qgraphicsitem.cpp 12
6550
6551 An item can only filter events for other items in the same
6552 scene. Also, an item cannot filter its own events; instead, you
6553 can reimplement sceneEvent() directly.
6554
6555 Items must belong to a scene for scene event filters to be installed and
6556 used.
6557
6558 \sa removeSceneEventFilter(), sceneEventFilter(), sceneEvent()
6559*/
6560void QGraphicsItem::installSceneEventFilter(QGraphicsItem *filterItem)
6561{
6562 if (!d_ptr->scene) {
6563 qWarning(msg: "QGraphicsItem::installSceneEventFilter: event filters can only be installed"
6564 " on items in a scene.");
6565 return;
6566 }
6567 if (d_ptr->scene != filterItem->scene()) {
6568 qWarning(msg: "QGraphicsItem::installSceneEventFilter: event filters can only be installed"
6569 " on items in the same scene.");
6570 return;
6571 }
6572 d_ptr->scene->d_func()->installSceneEventFilter(watched: this, filter: filterItem);
6573}
6574
6575/*!
6576 Removes an event filter on this item from \a filterItem.
6577
6578 \sa installSceneEventFilter()
6579*/
6580void QGraphicsItem::removeSceneEventFilter(QGraphicsItem *filterItem)
6581{
6582 if (!d_ptr->scene || d_ptr->scene != filterItem->scene())
6583 return;
6584 d_ptr->scene->d_func()->removeSceneEventFilter(watched: this, filter: filterItem);
6585}
6586
6587/*!
6588 Filters events for the item \a watched. \a event is the filtered
6589 event.
6590
6591 Reimplementing this function in a subclass makes it possible
6592 for the item to be used as an event filter for other items,
6593 intercepting all the events sent to those items before they are
6594 able to respond.
6595
6596 Reimplementations must return true to prevent further processing of
6597 a given event, ensuring that it will not be delivered to the watched
6598 item, or return false to indicate that the event should be propagated
6599 further by the event system.
6600
6601 \sa installSceneEventFilter()
6602*/
6603bool QGraphicsItem::sceneEventFilter(QGraphicsItem *watched, QEvent *event)
6604{
6605 Q_UNUSED(watched);
6606 Q_UNUSED(event);
6607 return false;
6608}
6609
6610/*!
6611 This virtual function receives events to this item. Reimplement
6612 this function to intercept events before they are dispatched to
6613 the specialized event handlers contextMenuEvent(), focusInEvent(),
6614 focusOutEvent(), hoverEnterEvent(), hoverMoveEvent(),
6615 hoverLeaveEvent(), keyPressEvent(), keyReleaseEvent(),
6616 mousePressEvent(), mouseReleaseEvent(), mouseMoveEvent(), and
6617 mouseDoubleClickEvent().
6618
6619 Returns \c true if the event was recognized and handled; otherwise, (e.g., if
6620 the event type was not recognized,) false is returned.
6621
6622 \a event is the intercepted event.
6623*/
6624bool QGraphicsItem::sceneEvent(QEvent *event)
6625{
6626 if (d_ptr->ancestorFlags & QGraphicsItemPrivate::AncestorHandlesChildEvents) {
6627 if (event->type() == QEvent::HoverEnter || event->type() == QEvent::HoverLeave
6628 || event->type() == QEvent::DragEnter || event->type() == QEvent::DragLeave) {
6629 // Hover enter and hover leave events for children are ignored;
6630 // hover move events are forwarded.
6631 return true;
6632 }
6633
6634 QGraphicsItem *handler = this;
6635 do {
6636 handler = handler->d_ptr->parent;
6637 Q_ASSERT(handler);
6638 } while (handler->d_ptr->ancestorFlags & QGraphicsItemPrivate::AncestorHandlesChildEvents);
6639 // Forward the event to the closest parent that handles child
6640 // events, mapping existing item-local coordinates to its
6641 // coordinate system.
6642 d_ptr->remapItemPos(event, item: handler);
6643 handler->sceneEvent(event);
6644 return true;
6645 }
6646
6647 if (event->type() == QEvent::FocusOut) {
6648 focusOutEvent(event: static_cast<QFocusEvent *>(event));
6649 return true;
6650 }
6651
6652 if (!d_ptr->visible) {
6653 // Eaten
6654 return true;
6655 }
6656
6657 switch (event->type()) {
6658 case QEvent::FocusIn:
6659 focusInEvent(event: static_cast<QFocusEvent *>(event));
6660 break;
6661 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneContextMenu:
6662 contextMenuEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneContextMenuEvent *>(event));
6663 break;
6664 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneDragEnter:
6665 dragEnterEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *>(event));
6666 break;
6667 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneDragMove:
6668 dragMoveEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *>(event));
6669 break;
6670 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneDragLeave:
6671 dragLeaveEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *>(event));
6672 break;
6673 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneDrop:
6674 dropEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *>(event));
6675 break;
6676 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneHoverEnter:
6677 hoverEnterEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent *>(event));
6678 break;
6679 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneHoverMove:
6680 hoverMoveEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent *>(event));
6681 break;
6682 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneHoverLeave:
6683 hoverLeaveEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent *>(event));
6684 break;
6685 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneMouseMove:
6686 mouseMoveEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *>(event));
6687 break;
6688 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneMousePress:
6689 mousePressEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *>(event));
6690 break;
6691 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneMouseRelease:
6692 mouseReleaseEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *>(event));
6693 break;
6694 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneMouseDoubleClick:
6695 mouseDoubleClickEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *>(event));
6696 break;
6697 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneWheel:
6698 wheelEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneWheelEvent *>(event));
6699 break;
6700 case QEvent::KeyPress: {
6701 QKeyEvent *k = static_cast<QKeyEvent *>(event);
6702 if (k->key() == Qt::Key_Tab || k->key() == Qt::Key_Backtab) {
6703 if (!(k->modifiers() & (Qt::ControlModifier | Qt::AltModifier))) { //### Add MetaModifier?
6704 bool res = false;
6705 if (k->key() == Qt::Key_Backtab
6706 || (k->key() == Qt::Key_Tab && (k->modifiers() & Qt::ShiftModifier))) {
6707 if (d_ptr->isWidget) {
6708 res = static_cast<QGraphicsWidget *>(this)->focusNextPrevChild(next: false);
6709 } else if (d_ptr->scene) {
6710 res = d_ptr->scene->focusNextPrevChild(next: false);
6711 }
6712 } else if (k->key() == Qt::Key_Tab) {
6713 if (d_ptr->isWidget) {
6714 res = static_cast<QGraphicsWidget *>(this)->focusNextPrevChild(next: true);
6715 } else if (d_ptr->scene) {
6716 res = d_ptr->scene->focusNextPrevChild(next: true);
6717 }
6718 }
6719 if (!res)
6720 event->ignore();
6721 return true;
6722 }
6723 }
6724 keyPressEvent(event: static_cast<QKeyEvent *>(event));
6725 break;
6726 }
6727 case QEvent::KeyRelease:
6728 keyReleaseEvent(event: static_cast<QKeyEvent *>(event));
6729 break;
6730 case QEvent::InputMethod:
6731 inputMethodEvent(event: static_cast<QInputMethodEvent *>(event));
6732 break;
6733 case QEvent::WindowActivate:
6734 case QEvent::WindowDeactivate:
6735 // Propagate panel activation.
6736 if (d_ptr->scene) {
6737 for (int i = 0; i < d_ptr->children.size(); ++i) {
6738 QGraphicsItem *child = d_ptr->children.at(i);
6739 if (child->isVisible() && !child->isPanel()) {
6740 if (!(child->d_ptr->ancestorFlags & QGraphicsItemPrivate::AncestorHandlesChildEvents))
6741 d_ptr->scene->sendEvent(item: child, event);
6742 }
6743 }
6744 }
6745 break;
6746 default:
6747 return false;
6748 }
6749
6750 return true;
6751}
6752
6753/*!
6754 This event handler can be reimplemented in a subclass to process context
6755 menu events. The \a event parameter contains details about the event to
6756 be handled.
6757
6758 If you ignore the event (i.e., by calling QEvent::ignore()), \a event
6759 will propagate to any item beneath this item. If no items accept the
6760 event, it will be ignored by the scene and propagate to the view.
6761
6762 It's common to open a QMenu in response to receiving a context menu
6763 event. Example:
6764
6765 \snippet code/src_gui_graphicsview_qgraphicsitem.cpp 13
6766
6767 The default implementation ignores the event.
6768
6769 \sa sceneEvent()
6770*/
6771void QGraphicsItem::contextMenuEvent(QGraphicsSceneContextMenuEvent *event)
6772{
6773 event->ignore();
6774}
6775
6776/*!
6777 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented to receive
6778 drag enter events for this item. Drag enter events are generated as the
6779 cursor enters the item's area.
6780
6781 By accepting the event (i.e., by calling QEvent::accept()), the item will
6782 accept drop events, in addition to receiving drag move and drag
6783 leave. Otherwise, the event will be ignored and propagate to the item
6784 beneath. If the event is accepted, the item will receive a drag move event
6785 before control goes back to the event loop.
6786
6787 A common implementation of dragEnterEvent accepts or ignores \a event
6788 depending on the associated mime data in \a event. Example:
6789
6790 \snippet code/src_gui_graphicsview_qgraphicsitem.cpp 14
6791
6792 Items do not receive drag and drop events by default; to enable this
6793 feature, call \c setAcceptDrops(true).
6794
6795 The default implementation does nothing.
6796
6797 \sa dropEvent(), dragMoveEvent(), dragLeaveEvent()
6798*/
6799void QGraphicsItem::dragEnterEvent(QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *event)
6800{
6801 Q_D(QGraphicsItem);
6802 // binary compatibility workaround between 4.4 and 4.5
6803 if (d->isProxyWidget())
6804 static_cast<QGraphicsProxyWidget*>(this)->dragEnterEvent(event);
6805}
6806
6807/*!
6808 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented to receive
6809 drag leave events for this item. Drag leave events are generated as the
6810 cursor leaves the item's area. Most often you will not need to reimplement
6811 this function, but it can be useful for resetting state in your item
6812 (e.g., highlighting).
6813
6814 Calling QEvent::ignore() or QEvent::accept() on \a event has no effect.
6815
6816 Items do not receive drag and drop events by default; to enable this
6817 feature, call \c setAcceptDrops(true).
6818
6819 The default implementation does nothing.
6820
6821 \sa dragEnterEvent(), dropEvent(), dragMoveEvent()
6822*/
6823void QGraphicsItem::dragLeaveEvent(QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *event)
6824{
6825 Q_D(QGraphicsItem);
6826 // binary compatibility workaround between 4.4 and 4.5
6827 if (d->isProxyWidget())
6828 static_cast<QGraphicsProxyWidget*>(this)->dragLeaveEvent(event);
6829}
6830
6831/*!
6832 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented to receive
6833 drag move events for this item. Drag move events are generated as the
6834 cursor moves around inside the item's area. Most often you will not need
6835 to reimplement this function; it is used to indicate that only parts of
6836 the item can accept drops.
6837
6838 Calling QEvent::ignore() or QEvent::accept() on \a event toggles whether
6839 or not the item will accept drops at the position from the event. By
6840 default, \a event is accepted, indicating that the item allows drops at
6841 the specified position.
6842
6843 Items do not receive drag and drop events by default; to enable this
6844 feature, call \c setAcceptDrops(true).
6845
6846 The default implementation does nothing.
6847
6848 \sa dropEvent(), dragEnterEvent(), dragLeaveEvent()
6849*/
6850void QGraphicsItem::dragMoveEvent(QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *event)
6851{
6852 Q_D(QGraphicsItem);
6853 // binary compatibility workaround between 4.4 and 4.5
6854 if (d->isProxyWidget())
6855 static_cast<QGraphicsProxyWidget*>(this)->dragMoveEvent(event);
6856}
6857
6858/*!
6859 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented to receive
6860 drop events for this item. Items can only receive drop events if the last
6861 drag move event was accepted.
6862
6863 Calling QEvent::ignore() or QEvent::accept() on \a event has no effect.
6864
6865 Items do not receive drag and drop events by default; to enable this
6866 feature, call \c setAcceptDrops(true).
6867
6868 The default implementation does nothing.
6869
6870 \sa dragEnterEvent(), dragMoveEvent(), dragLeaveEvent()
6871*/
6872void QGraphicsItem::dropEvent(QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *event)
6873{
6874 Q_D(QGraphicsItem);
6875 // binary compatibility workaround between 4.4 and 4.5
6876 if (d->isProxyWidget())
6877 static_cast<QGraphicsProxyWidget*>(this)->dropEvent(event);
6878}
6879
6880/*!
6881 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented to receive
6882 focus in events for this item. The default implementation calls
6883 ensureVisible().
6884
6885 \sa focusOutEvent(), sceneEvent(), setFocus()
6886*/
6887void QGraphicsItem::focusInEvent(QFocusEvent *event)
6888{
6889 Q_UNUSED(event);
6890 update();
6891}
6892
6893/*!
6894 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented to receive
6895 focus out events for this item. The default implementation does nothing.
6896
6897 \sa focusInEvent(), sceneEvent(), setFocus()
6898*/
6899void QGraphicsItem::focusOutEvent(QFocusEvent *event)
6900{
6901 Q_UNUSED(event);
6902 update();
6903}
6904
6905/*!
6906 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented to receive
6907 hover enter events for this item. The default implementation calls
6908 update(); otherwise it does nothing.
6909
6910 Calling QEvent::ignore() or QEvent::accept() on \a event has no effect.
6911
6912 \sa hoverMoveEvent(), hoverLeaveEvent(), sceneEvent(), setAcceptHoverEvents()
6913*/
6914void QGraphicsItem::hoverEnterEvent(QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent *event)
6915{
6916 Q_UNUSED(event);
6917 update();
6918}
6919
6920/*!
6921 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented to receive
6922 hover move events for this item. The default implementation does nothing.
6923
6924 Calling QEvent::ignore() or QEvent::accept() on \a event has no effect.
6925
6926 \sa hoverEnterEvent(), hoverLeaveEvent(), sceneEvent(), setAcceptHoverEvents()
6927*/
6928void QGraphicsItem::hoverMoveEvent(QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent *event)
6929{
6930 Q_UNUSED(event);
6931}
6932
6933/*!
6934 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented to receive
6935 hover leave events for this item. The default implementation calls
6936 update(); otherwise it does nothing.
6937
6938 Calling QEvent::ignore() or QEvent::accept() on \a event has no effect.
6939
6940 \sa hoverEnterEvent(), hoverMoveEvent(), sceneEvent(), setAcceptHoverEvents()
6941*/
6942void QGraphicsItem::hoverLeaveEvent(QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent *event)
6943{
6944 Q_UNUSED(event);
6945 update();
6946}
6947
6948/*!
6949 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented to
6950 receive key press events for this item. The default implementation
6951 ignores the event. If you reimplement this handler, the event will by
6952 default be accepted.
6953
6954 Note that key events are only received for items that set the
6955 ItemIsFocusable flag, and that have keyboard input focus.
6956
6957 \sa keyReleaseEvent(), setFocus(), QGraphicsScene::setFocusItem(),
6958 sceneEvent()
6959*/
6960void QGraphicsItem::keyPressEvent(QKeyEvent *event)
6961{
6962 event->ignore();
6963}
6964
6965/*!
6966 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented to receive
6967 key release events for this item. The default implementation
6968 ignores the event. If you reimplement this handler, the event will by
6969 default be accepted.
6970
6971 Note that key events are only received for items that set the
6972 ItemIsFocusable flag, and that have keyboard input focus.
6973
6974 \sa keyPressEvent(), setFocus(), QGraphicsScene::setFocusItem(),
6975 sceneEvent()
6976*/
6977void QGraphicsItem::keyReleaseEvent(QKeyEvent *event)
6978{
6979 event->ignore();
6980}
6981
6982/*!
6983 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented to
6984 receive mouse press events for this item. Mouse press events are
6985 only delivered to items that accept the mouse button that is
6986 pressed. By default, an item accepts all mouse buttons, but you
6987 can change this by calling setAcceptedMouseButtons().
6988
6989 The mouse press event decides which item should become the mouse
6990 grabber (see QGraphicsScene::mouseGrabberItem()). If you do not
6991 reimplement this function, the press event will propagate to any
6992 topmost item beneath this item, and no other mouse events will be
6993 delivered to this item.
6994
6995 If you do reimplement this function, \a event will by default be
6996 accepted (see QEvent::accept()), and this item is then the mouse
6997 grabber. This allows the item to receive future move, release and
6998 double-click events. If you call QEvent::ignore() on \a event, this
6999 item will lose the mouse grab, and \a event will propagate to any
7000 topmost item beneath. No further mouse events will be delivered to
7001 this item unless a new mouse press event is received.
7002
7003 The default implementation handles basic item interaction, such as
7004 selection and moving. If you want to keep the base implementation
7005 when reimplementing this function, call
7006 QGraphicsItem::mousePressEvent() in your reimplementation.
7007
7008 The event is \l{QEvent::ignore()}d for items that are neither
7009 \l{QGraphicsItem::ItemIsMovable}{movable} nor
7010 \l{QGraphicsItem::ItemIsSelectable}{selectable}.
7011
7012 \sa mouseMoveEvent(), mouseReleaseEvent(),
7013 mouseDoubleClickEvent(), sceneEvent()
7014*/
7015void QGraphicsItem::mousePressEvent(QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *event)
7016{
7017 if (event->button() == Qt::LeftButton && (flags() & ItemIsSelectable)) {
7018 bool multiSelect = (event->modifiers() & Qt::ControlModifier) != 0;
7019 if (!multiSelect) {
7020 if (!d_ptr->selected) {
7021 if (QGraphicsScene *scene = d_ptr->scene) {
7022 ++scene->d_func()->selectionChanging;
7023 scene->clearSelection();
7024 --scene->d_func()->selectionChanging;
7025 }
7026 setSelected(true);
7027 }
7028 }
7029 } else if (!(flags() & ItemIsMovable)) {
7030 event->ignore();
7031 }
7032 if (d_ptr->isWidget) {
7033 // Qt::Popup closes when you click outside.
7034 QGraphicsWidget *w = static_cast<QGraphicsWidget *>(this);
7035 if ((w->windowFlags() & Qt::Popup) == Qt::Popup) {
7036 event->accept();
7037 if (!w->rect().contains(p: event->pos()))
7038 w->close();
7039 }
7040 }
7041}
7042
7043bool _qt_movableAncestorIsSelected(const QGraphicsItem *item)
7044{
7045 const QGraphicsItem *parent = item->parentItem();
7046 return parent && (((parent->flags() & QGraphicsItem::ItemIsMovable) && parent->isSelected()) || _qt_movableAncestorIsSelected(item: parent));
7047}
7048
7049bool QGraphicsItemPrivate::movableAncestorIsSelected(const QGraphicsItem *item)
7050{
7051 const QGraphicsItem *parent = item->d_ptr->parent;
7052 return parent && (((parent->flags() & QGraphicsItem::ItemIsMovable) && parent->isSelected()) || _qt_movableAncestorIsSelected(item: parent));
7053}
7054
7055/*!
7056 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented to
7057 receive mouse move events for this item. If you do receive this
7058 event, you can be certain that this item also received a mouse
7059 press event, and that this item is the current mouse grabber.
7060
7061 Calling QEvent::ignore() or QEvent::accept() on \a event has no
7062 effect.
7063
7064 The default implementation handles basic item interaction, such as
7065 selection and moving. If you want to keep the base implementation
7066 when reimplementing this function, call
7067 QGraphicsItem::mouseMoveEvent() in your reimplementation.
7068
7069 Please note that mousePressEvent() decides which graphics item it
7070 is that receives mouse events. See the mousePressEvent()
7071 description for details.
7072
7073 \sa mousePressEvent(), mouseReleaseEvent(),
7074 mouseDoubleClickEvent(), sceneEvent()
7075*/
7076void QGraphicsItem::mouseMoveEvent(QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *event)
7077{
7078 if ((event->buttons() & Qt::LeftButton) && (flags() & ItemIsMovable)) {
7079 // Determine the list of items that need to be moved.
7080 QList<QGraphicsItem *> selectedItems;
7081 QHash<QGraphicsItem *, QPointF> initialPositions;
7082 if (d_ptr->scene) {
7083 selectedItems = d_ptr->scene->selectedItems();
7084 initialPositions = d_ptr->scene->d_func()->movingItemsInitialPositions;
7085 if (initialPositions.isEmpty()) {
7086 for (QGraphicsItem *item : std::as_const(t&: selectedItems))
7087 initialPositions[item] = item->pos();
7088 initialPositions[this] = pos();
7089 }
7090 d_ptr->scene->d_func()->movingItemsInitialPositions = initialPositions;
7091 }
7092
7093 // Find the active view.
7094 QGraphicsView *view = nullptr;
7095 if (event->widget())
7096 view = qobject_cast<QGraphicsView *>(object: event->widget()->parentWidget());
7097
7098 // Move all selected items
7099 int i = 0;
7100 bool movedMe = false;
7101 while (i <= selectedItems.size()) {
7102 QGraphicsItem *item = nullptr;
7103 if (i < selectedItems.size())
7104 item = selectedItems.at(i);
7105 else
7106 item = this;
7107 if (item == this) {
7108 // Slightly clumsy-looking way to ensure that "this" is part
7109 // of the list of items to move, this is to avoid allocations
7110 // (appending this item to the list of selected items causes a
7111 // detach).
7112 if (movedMe)
7113 break;
7114 movedMe = true;
7115 }
7116
7117 if ((item->flags() & ItemIsMovable) && !QGraphicsItemPrivate::movableAncestorIsSelected(item)) {
7118 QPointF currentParentPos;
7119 QPointF buttonDownParentPos;
7120 if (view && (item->d_ptr->ancestorFlags & QGraphicsItemPrivate::AncestorIgnoresTransformations)) {
7121 // Items whose ancestors ignore transformations need to
7122 // map screen coordinates to local coordinates, then map
7123 // those to the parent.
7124 QTransform viewToItemTransform = (item->deviceTransform(viewportTransform: view->viewportTransform())).inverted();
7125 currentParentPos = mapToParent(point: viewToItemTransform.map(p: QPointF(view->mapFromGlobal(event->screenPos()))));
7126 buttonDownParentPos = mapToParent(point: viewToItemTransform.map(p: QPointF(view->mapFromGlobal(event->buttonDownScreenPos(button: Qt::LeftButton)))));
7127 } else if (view && (item->flags() & ItemIgnoresTransformations)) {
7128 // Root items that ignore transformations need to
7129 // calculate their diff by mapping viewport coordinates
7130 // directly to parent coordinates.
7131 // COMBINE
7132 QTransform itemTransform;
7133 if (item->d_ptr->transformData)
7134 itemTransform = item->d_ptr->transformData->computedFullTransform();
7135 itemTransform.translate(dx: item->d_ptr->pos.x(), dy: item->d_ptr->pos.y());
7136 QTransform viewToParentTransform = itemTransform
7137 * (item->sceneTransform() * view->viewportTransform()).inverted();
7138 currentParentPos = viewToParentTransform.map(p: QPointF(view->mapFromGlobal(event->screenPos())));
7139 buttonDownParentPos = viewToParentTransform.map(p: QPointF(view->mapFromGlobal(event->buttonDownScreenPos(button: Qt::LeftButton))));
7140 } else {
7141 // All other items simply map from the scene.
7142 currentParentPos = item->mapToParent(point: item->mapFromScene(point: event->scenePos()));
7143 buttonDownParentPos = item->mapToParent(point: item->mapFromScene(point: event->buttonDownScenePos(button: Qt::LeftButton)));
7144 }
7145
7146 item->setPos(initialPositions.value(key: item) + currentParentPos - buttonDownParentPos);
7147
7148 if (item->flags() & ItemIsSelectable)
7149 item->setSelected(true);
7150 }
7151 ++i;
7152 }
7153
7154 } else {
7155 event->ignore();
7156 }
7157}
7158
7159/*!
7160 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented to
7161 receive mouse release events for this item.
7162
7163 Calling QEvent::ignore() or QEvent::accept() on \a event has no
7164 effect.
7165
7166 The default implementation handles basic item interaction, such as
7167 selection and moving. If you want to keep the base implementation
7168 when reimplementing this function, call
7169 QGraphicsItem::mouseReleaseEvent() in your reimplementation.
7170
7171 Please note that mousePressEvent() decides which graphics item it
7172 is that receives mouse events. See the mousePressEvent()
7173 description for details.
7174
7175 \sa mousePressEvent(), mouseMoveEvent(), mouseDoubleClickEvent(),
7176 sceneEvent()
7177*/
7178void QGraphicsItem::mouseReleaseEvent(QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *event)
7179{
7180 if (event->button() == Qt::LeftButton && (flags() & ItemIsSelectable)) {
7181 bool multiSelect = (event->modifiers() & Qt::ControlModifier) != 0;
7182 if (event->scenePos() == event->buttonDownScenePos(button: Qt::LeftButton)) {
7183 // The item didn't move
7184 if (multiSelect) {
7185 setSelected(!isSelected());
7186 } else {
7187 bool selectionChanged = false;
7188 if (QGraphicsScene *scene = d_ptr->scene) {
7189 ++scene->d_func()->selectionChanging;
7190 // Clear everything but this item. Bypass
7191 // QGraphicsScene::clearSelection()'s default behavior by
7192 // temporarily removing this item from the selection list.
7193 if (d_ptr->selected) {
7194 scene->d_func()->selectedItems.remove(value: this);
7195 for (QGraphicsItem *item : std::as_const(t&: scene->d_func()->selectedItems)) {
7196 if (item->isSelected()) {
7197 selectionChanged = true;
7198 break;
7199 }
7200 }
7201 }
7202 scene->clearSelection();
7203 if (d_ptr->selected)
7204 scene->d_func()->selectedItems.insert(value: this);
7205 --scene->d_func()->selectionChanging;
7206 if (selectionChanged)
7207 emit d_ptr->scene->selectionChanged();
7208 }
7209 setSelected(true);
7210 }
7211 }
7212 }
7213 if (d_ptr->scene && !event->buttons())
7214 d_ptr->scene->d_func()->movingItemsInitialPositions.clear();
7215}
7216
7217/*!
7218 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented to
7219 receive mouse double-click events for this item.
7220
7221 When doubleclicking an item, the item will first receive a mouse
7222 press event, followed by a release event (i.e., a click), then a
7223 double-click event, and finally a release event.
7224
7225 Calling QEvent::ignore() or QEvent::accept() on \a event has no
7226 effect.
7227
7228 The default implementation calls mousePressEvent(). If you want to
7229 keep the base implementation when reimplementing this function,
7230 call QGraphicsItem::mouseDoubleClickEvent() in your
7231 reimplementation.
7232
7233 Note that an item will not receive double click events if it is
7234 neither \l {QGraphicsItem::ItemIsSelectable}{selectable} nor
7235 \l{QGraphicsItem::ItemIsMovable}{movable} (single mouse clicks are
7236 ignored in this case, and that stops the generation of double
7237 clicks).
7238
7239 \sa mousePressEvent(), mouseMoveEvent(), mouseReleaseEvent(), sceneEvent()
7240*/
7241void QGraphicsItem::mouseDoubleClickEvent(QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *event)
7242{
7243 mousePressEvent(event);
7244}
7245
7246/*!
7247 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented to receive
7248 wheel events for this item. If you reimplement this function, \a event
7249 will be accepted by default.
7250
7251 If you ignore the event, (i.e., by calling QEvent::ignore(),) it will
7252 propagate to any item beneath this item. If no items accept the event, it
7253 will be ignored by the scene, and propagate to the view (e.g., the view's
7254 vertical scroll bar).
7255
7256 The default implementation ignores the event.
7257
7258 \sa sceneEvent()
7259*/
7260void QGraphicsItem::wheelEvent(QGraphicsSceneWheelEvent *event)
7261{
7262 event->ignore();
7263}
7264
7265/*!
7266 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented to receive
7267 input method events for this item. The default implementation ignores the
7268 event.
7269
7270 \sa inputMethodQuery(), sceneEvent()
7271*/
7272void QGraphicsItem::inputMethodEvent(QInputMethodEvent *event)
7273{
7274 event->ignore();
7275}
7276
7277/*!
7278 This method is only relevant for input items. It is used by the
7279 input method to query a set of properties of the item to be able
7280 to support complex input method operations, such as support for
7281 surrounding text and reconversions. \a query specifies which
7282 property is queried.
7283
7284 \sa inputMethodEvent(), QInputMethodEvent
7285*/
7286QVariant QGraphicsItem::inputMethodQuery(Qt::InputMethodQuery query) const
7287{
7288 Q_UNUSED(query);
7289 return QVariant();
7290}
7291
7292/*!
7293 Returns the current input method hints of this item.
7294
7295 Input method hints are only relevant for input items.
7296 The hints are used by the input method to indicate how it should operate.
7297 For example, if the Qt::ImhNumbersOnly flag is set, the input method may change
7298 its visual components to reflect that only numbers can be entered.
7299
7300 The effect may vary between input method implementations.
7301
7302 \since 4.6
7303
7304 \sa setInputMethodHints(), inputMethodQuery()
7305*/
7306Qt::InputMethodHints QGraphicsItem::inputMethodHints() const
7307{
7308 Q_D(const QGraphicsItem);
7309 return d->imHints;
7310}
7311
7312/*!
7313 Sets the current input method hints of this item to \a hints.
7314
7315 \since 4.6
7316
7317 \sa inputMethodHints(), inputMethodQuery()
7318*/
7319void QGraphicsItem::setInputMethodHints(Qt::InputMethodHints hints)
7320{
7321 Q_D(QGraphicsItem);
7322 d->imHints = hints;
7323 if (!hasFocus())
7324 return;
7325 d->scene->d_func()->updateInputMethodSensitivityInViews();
7326 QWidget *fw = QApplication::focusWidget();
7327 if (!fw)
7328 return;
7329 QGuiApplication::inputMethod()->update(queries: Qt::ImHints);
7330}
7331
7332/*!
7333 Updates the item's micro focus.
7334
7335 \since 4.7
7336
7337 \sa QInputMethod
7338*/
7339void QGraphicsItem::updateMicroFocus()
7340{
7341}
7342
7343/*!
7344 This virtual function is called by QGraphicsItem to notify custom items
7345 that some part of the item's state changes. By reimplementing this
7346 function, you can react to a change, and in some cases (depending on \a
7347 change), adjustments can be made.
7348
7349 \a change is the parameter of the item that is changing. \a value is the
7350 new value; the type of the value depends on \a change.
7351
7352 Example:
7353
7354 \snippet code/src_gui_graphicsview_qgraphicsitem.cpp 15
7355
7356 The default implementation does nothing, and returns \a value.
7357
7358 Note: Certain QGraphicsItem functions cannot be called in a
7359 reimplementation of this function; see the GraphicsItemChange
7360 documentation for details.
7361
7362 \sa GraphicsItemChange
7363*/
7364QVariant QGraphicsItem::itemChange(GraphicsItemChange change, const QVariant &value)
7365{
7366 Q_UNUSED(change);
7367 return value;
7368}
7369
7370/*!
7371 \internal
7372
7373 Note: This is provided as a hook to avoid future problems related
7374 to adding virtual functions.
7375*/
7376bool QGraphicsItem::supportsExtension(Extension extension) const
7377{
7378 Q_UNUSED(extension);
7379 return false;
7380}
7381
7382/*!
7383 \internal
7384
7385 Note: This is provided as a hook to avoid future problems related
7386 to adding virtual functions.
7387*/
7388void QGraphicsItem::setExtension(Extension extension, const QVariant &variant)
7389{
7390 Q_UNUSED(extension);
7391 Q_UNUSED(variant);
7392}
7393
7394/*!
7395 \internal
7396
7397 Note: This is provided as a hook to avoid future problems related
7398 to adding virtual functions.
7399*/
7400QVariant QGraphicsItem::extension(const QVariant &variant) const
7401{
7402 Q_UNUSED(variant);
7403 return QVariant();
7404}
7405
7406/*!
7407 \internal
7408
7409 Adds this item to the scene's index. Called in conjunction with
7410 removeFromIndex() to ensure the index bookkeeping is correct when
7411 the item's position, transformation or shape changes.
7412*/
7413void QGraphicsItem::addToIndex()
7414{
7415 if (d_ptr->ancestorFlags & QGraphicsItemPrivate::AncestorClipsChildren
7416 || d_ptr->ancestorFlags & QGraphicsItemPrivate::AncestorContainsChildren) {
7417 // ### add to child index only if applicable
7418 return;
7419 }
7420 if (d_ptr->scene)
7421 d_ptr->scene->d_func()->index->addItem(item: this);
7422}
7423
7424/*!
7425 \internal
7426
7427 Removes this item from the scene's index. Called in conjunction
7428 with addToIndex() to ensure the index bookkeeping is correct when
7429 the item's position, transformation or shape changes.
7430*/
7431void QGraphicsItem::removeFromIndex()
7432{
7433 if (d_ptr->ancestorFlags & QGraphicsItemPrivate::AncestorClipsChildren
7434 || d_ptr->ancestorFlags & QGraphicsItemPrivate::AncestorContainsChildren) {
7435 // ### remove from child index only if applicable
7436 return;
7437 }
7438 if (d_ptr->scene)
7439 d_ptr->scene->d_func()->index->removeItem(item: this);
7440}
7441
7442/*!
7443 Prepares the item for a geometry change. Call this function before
7444 changing the bounding rect of an item to keep QGraphicsScene's index up to
7445 date.
7446
7447 prepareGeometryChange() will call update() if this is necessary.
7448
7449 Example:
7450
7451 \snippet code/src_gui_graphicsview_qgraphicsitem.cpp 16
7452
7453 \sa boundingRect()
7454*/
7455void QGraphicsItem::prepareGeometryChange()
7456{
7457 if (d_ptr->inDestructor)
7458 return;
7459 if (d_ptr->scene) {
7460 d_ptr->scene->d_func()->dirtyGrowingItemsBoundingRect = true;
7461 d_ptr->geometryChanged = 1;
7462 d_ptr->paintedViewBoundingRectsNeedRepaint = 1;
7463 d_ptr->notifyBoundingRectChanged = !d_ptr->inSetPosHelper;
7464
7465 QGraphicsScenePrivate *scenePrivate = d_ptr->scene->d_func();
7466 scenePrivate->index->prepareBoundingRectChange(item: this);
7467 scenePrivate->markDirty(item: this, rect: QRectF(), /*invalidateChildren=*/true, /*force=*/false,
7468 /*ignoreOpacity=*/ false, /*removingItemFromScene=*/ false,
7469 /*updateBoundingRect=*/true);
7470
7471 // For compatibility reasons, we have to update the item's old geometry
7472 // if someone is connected to the changed signal or the scene has no views.
7473 // Note that this has to be done *after* markDirty to ensure that
7474 // _q_processDirtyItems is called before _q_emitUpdated.
7475 if (scenePrivate->isSignalConnected(signalIdx: scenePrivate->changedSignalIndex)
7476 || scenePrivate->views.isEmpty()) {
7477 if (d_ptr->hasTranslateOnlySceneTransform()) {
7478 d_ptr->scene->update(rect: boundingRect().translated(dx: d_ptr->sceneTransform.dx(),
7479 dy: d_ptr->sceneTransform.dy()));
7480 } else {
7481 d_ptr->scene->update(rect: d_ptr->sceneTransform.mapRect(boundingRect()));
7482 }
7483 }
7484 }
7485
7486 d_ptr->markParentDirty(/*updateBoundingRect=*/true);
7487}
7488
7489/*!
7490 \internal
7491
7492 Highlights \a item as selected.
7493*/
7494void Q_WIDGETS_EXPORT qt_graphicsItem_highlightSelected(
7495 QGraphicsItem *item, QPainter *painter, const QStyleOptionGraphicsItem *option)
7496{
7497 const QRectF murect = painter->transform().mapRect(QRectF(0, 0, 1, 1));
7498 if (qFuzzyIsNull(d: qMax(a: murect.width(), b: murect.height())))
7499 return;
7500
7501 const QRectF mbrect = painter->transform().mapRect(item->boundingRect());
7502 if (qMin(a: mbrect.width(), b: mbrect.height()) < qreal(1.0))
7503 return;
7504
7505 qreal itemPenWidth;
7506 switch (item->type()) {
7507 case QGraphicsEllipseItem::Type:
7508 itemPenWidth = static_cast<QGraphicsEllipseItem *>(item)->pen().widthF();
7509 break;
7510 case QGraphicsPathItem::Type:
7511 itemPenWidth = static_cast<QGraphicsPathItem *>(item)->pen().widthF();
7512 break;
7513 case QGraphicsPolygonItem::Type:
7514 itemPenWidth = static_cast<QGraphicsPolygonItem *>(item)->pen().widthF();
7515 break;
7516 case QGraphicsRectItem::Type:
7517 itemPenWidth = static_cast<QGraphicsRectItem *>(item)->pen().widthF();
7518 break;
7519 case QGraphicsSimpleTextItem::Type:
7520 itemPenWidth = static_cast<QGraphicsSimpleTextItem *>(item)->pen().widthF();
7521 break;
7522 case QGraphicsLineItem::Type:
7523 itemPenWidth = static_cast<QGraphicsLineItem *>(item)->pen().widthF();
7524 break;
7525 default:
7526 itemPenWidth = 1.0;
7527 }
7528 const qreal pad = itemPenWidth / 2;
7529
7530 const qreal penWidth = 0; // cosmetic pen
7531
7532 const QColor fgcolor = option->palette.windowText().color();
7533 const QColor bgcolor( // ensure good contrast against fgcolor
7534 fgcolor.red() > 127 ? 0 : 255,
7535 fgcolor.green() > 127 ? 0 : 255,
7536 fgcolor.blue() > 127 ? 0 : 255);
7537
7538 painter->setPen(QPen(bgcolor, penWidth, Qt::SolidLine));
7539 painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
7540 painter->drawRect(rect: item->boundingRect().adjusted(xp1: pad, yp1: pad, xp2: -pad, yp2: -pad));
7541
7542 painter->setPen(QPen(option->palette.windowText(), 0, Qt::DashLine));
7543 painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
7544 painter->drawRect(rect: item->boundingRect().adjusted(xp1: pad, yp1: pad, xp2: -pad, yp2: -pad));
7545}
7546
7547/*!
7548 \class QGraphicsObject
7549 \brief The QGraphicsObject class provides a base class for all graphics items that
7550 require signals, slots and properties.
7551 \since 4.6
7552 \ingroup graphicsview-api
7553 \inmodule QtWidgets
7554
7555 The class extends a QGraphicsItem with QObject's signal/slot and property mechanisms.
7556 It maps many of QGraphicsItem's basic setters and getters to properties and adds notification
7557 signals for many of them.
7558
7559 \section1 Parents and Children
7560
7561 Each graphics object can be constructed with a parent item. This ensures that the
7562 item will be destroyed when its parent item is destroyed. Although QGraphicsObject
7563 inherits from both QObject and QGraphicsItem, you should use the functions provided
7564 by QGraphicsItem, \e not QObject, to manage the relationships between parent and
7565 child items.
7566
7567 The relationships between items can be explored using the parentItem() and childItems()
7568 functions. In the hierarchy of items in a scene, the parentObject() and parentWidget()
7569 functions are the equivalent of the QWidget::parent() and QWidget::parentWidget()
7570 functions for QWidget subclasses.
7571
7572 \sa QGraphicsWidget
7573*/
7574
7575/*!
7576 Constructs a QGraphicsObject with \a parent.
7577*/
7578QGraphicsObject::QGraphicsObject(QGraphicsItem *parent)
7579 : QGraphicsItem(parent)
7580{
7581 QGraphicsItem::d_ptr->isObject = true;
7582}
7583
7584/*!
7585 \internal
7586*/
7587QGraphicsObject::QGraphicsObject(QGraphicsItemPrivate &dd, QGraphicsItem *parent)
7588 : QGraphicsItem(dd, parent)
7589{
7590 QGraphicsItem::d_ptr->isObject = true;
7591}
7592
7593/*!
7594 Destructor.
7595*/
7596QGraphicsObject::~QGraphicsObject()
7597{
7598}
7599
7600/*!
7601 \reimp
7602*/
7603bool QGraphicsObject::event(QEvent *ev)
7604{
7605 if (ev->type() == QEvent::StyleAnimationUpdate) {
7606 if (isVisible()) {
7607 ev->accept();
7608 update();
7609 }
7610 return true;
7611 }
7612 return QObject::event(event: ev);
7613}
7614
7615#ifndef QT_NO_GESTURES
7616/*!
7617 Subscribes the graphics object to the given \a gesture with specific \a flags.
7618
7619 \sa ungrabGesture(), QGestureEvent
7620*/
7621void QGraphicsObject::grabGesture(Qt::GestureType gesture, Qt::GestureFlags flags)
7622{
7623 bool contains = QGraphicsItem::d_ptr->gestureContext.contains(key: gesture);
7624 QGraphicsItem::d_ptr->gestureContext.insert(key: gesture, value: flags);
7625 if (!contains && QGraphicsItem::d_ptr->scene)
7626 QGraphicsItem::d_ptr->scene->d_func()->grabGesture(this, gesture);
7627}
7628
7629/*!
7630 Unsubscribes the graphics object from the given \a gesture.
7631
7632 \sa grabGesture(), QGestureEvent
7633*/
7634void QGraphicsObject::ungrabGesture(Qt::GestureType gesture)
7635{
7636 if (QGraphicsItem::d_ptr->gestureContext.remove(key: gesture) && QGraphicsItem::d_ptr->scene)
7637 QGraphicsItem::d_ptr->scene->d_func()->ungrabGesture(this, gesture);
7638}
7639#endif // QT_NO_GESTURES
7640
7641/*!
7642 Updates the item's micro focus. This is slot for convenience.
7643
7644 \since 4.7
7645
7646 \sa QInputMethod
7647*/
7648void QGraphicsObject::updateMicroFocus()
7649{
7650 QGraphicsItem::updateMicroFocus();
7651}
7652
7653void QGraphicsItemPrivate::children_append(QDeclarativeListProperty<QGraphicsObject> *list, QGraphicsObject *item)
7654{
7655 if (item) {
7656 QGraphicsObject *graphicsObject = static_cast<QGraphicsObject *>(list->object);
7657 if (QGraphicsItemPrivate::get(item: graphicsObject)->sendParentChangeNotification) {
7658 item->setParentItem(graphicsObject);
7659 } else {
7660 QGraphicsItemPrivate::get(item)->setParentItemHelper(newParent: graphicsObject, newParentVariant: nullptr, thisPointerVariant: nullptr);
7661 }
7662 }
7663}
7664
7665int QGraphicsItemPrivate::children_count(QDeclarativeListProperty<QGraphicsObject> *list)
7666{
7667 QGraphicsItemPrivate *d = QGraphicsItemPrivate::get(item: static_cast<QGraphicsObject *>(list->object));
7668 return d->children.size();
7669}
7670
7671QGraphicsObject *QGraphicsItemPrivate::children_at(QDeclarativeListProperty<QGraphicsObject> *list, int index)
7672{
7673 QGraphicsItemPrivate *d = QGraphicsItemPrivate::get(item: static_cast<QGraphicsObject *>(list->object));
7674 if (index >= 0 && index < d->children.size())
7675 return d->children.at(i: index)->toGraphicsObject();
7676 else
7677 return nullptr;
7678}
7679
7680void QGraphicsItemPrivate::children_clear(QDeclarativeListProperty<QGraphicsObject> *list)
7681{
7682 QGraphicsItemPrivate *d = QGraphicsItemPrivate::get(item: static_cast<QGraphicsObject *>(list->object));
7683 int childCount = d->children.size();
7684 if (d->sendParentChangeNotification) {
7685 for (int index = 0; index < childCount; index++)
7686 d->children.at(i: 0)->setParentItem(nullptr);
7687 } else {
7688 for (int index = 0; index < childCount; index++)
7689 QGraphicsItemPrivate::get(item: d->children.at(i: 0))->setParentItemHelper(newParent: nullptr, newParentVariant: nullptr, thisPointerVariant: nullptr);
7690 }
7691}
7692
7693/*!
7694 Returns a list of this item's children.
7695
7696 The items are sorted by stacking order. This takes into account both the
7697 items' insertion order and their Z-values.
7698
7699*/
7700QDeclarativeListProperty<QGraphicsObject> QGraphicsItemPrivate::childrenList()
7701{
7702 Q_Q(QGraphicsItem);
7703 if (isObject) {
7704 QGraphicsObject *that = static_cast<QGraphicsObject *>(q);
7705 return QDeclarativeListProperty<QGraphicsObject>(that, &children, children_append,
7706 children_count, children_at, children_clear);
7707 } else {
7708 //QGraphicsItem is not supported for this property
7709 return QDeclarativeListProperty<QGraphicsObject>();
7710 }
7711}
7712

7714 \internal

7718qreal QGraphicsItemPrivate::width() const

7776

7779 \since 4.7
7780 \internal
7781*/
7782

7784 \property QGraphicsObject::height
7785 \since 4.7
7786 \internal
7787*/

7789/*!
7790 \property QGraphicsObject::parent
7791 \brief the parent of the item
7792
7793 \note The item's parent is set independently of the parent object returned
7794 by QObject::parent().
7795
7796 \sa QGraphicsItem::setParentItem(), QGraphicsItem::parentObject()
7797*/
7798
7799/*!
7800 \property QGraphicsObject::opacity
7801 \brief the opacity of the item
7802
7803 \sa QGraphicsItem::setOpacity(), QGraphicsItem::opacity()
7804*/
7805
7806/*!
7807 \fn QGraphicsObject::opacityChanged()
7808
7809 This signal gets emitted whenever the opacity of the item changes
7810
7811 \sa QGraphicsItem::opacity()
7812*/
7813
7814/*!
7815 \fn QGraphicsObject::parentChanged()
7816
7817 This signal gets emitted whenever the parent of the item changes
7818*/
7819
7820/*!
7821 \property QGraphicsObject::pos
7822 \brief the position of the item
7823
7824 Describes the items position.
7825
7826 \sa QGraphicsItem::setPos(), QGraphicsItem::pos()
7827*/
7828
7829/*!
7830 \property QGraphicsObject::x
7831 \brief the x position of the item
7832
7833 Describes the items x position.
7834
7835 \sa QGraphicsItem::setX(), setPos()
7836*/
7837
7838/*!
7839 \fn QGraphicsObject::xChanged()
7840
7841 This signal gets emitted whenever the x position of the item changes
7842
7843 \sa pos()
7844*/
7845
7846/*!
7847 \property QGraphicsObject::y
7848 \brief the y position of the item
7849
7850 Describes the items y position.
7851
7852 \sa QGraphicsItem::setY(), setPos()
7853*/
7854
7855/*!
7856 \fn QGraphicsObject::yChanged()
7857
7858 This signal gets emitted whenever the y position of the item changes.
7859
7860 \sa pos()
7861*/
7862
7863/*!
7864 \property QGraphicsObject::z
7865 \brief the z value of the item
7866
7867 Describes the items z value.
7868
7869 \sa QGraphicsItem::setZValue(), zValue()
7870*/
7871
7872/*!
7873 \fn QGraphicsObject::zChanged()
7874
7875 This signal gets emitted whenever the z value of the item changes.
7876
7877 \sa pos()
7878*/
7879
7880/*!
7881 \property QGraphicsObject::rotation
7882 \brief the rotation of the item in degrees.
7883
7884 This specifies how many degrees to rotate the item around its transformOrigin.
7885 The default rotation is 0 degrees (i.e. not rotated at all).
7886*/
7887
7888/*!
7889 \fn QGraphicsObject::rotationChanged()
7890
7891 This signal gets emitted whenever the rotation of the item changes.
7892*/
7893
7894/*!
7895 \property QGraphicsObject::scale
7896 \brief the scale of the item.
7897
7898 A scale of less than 1 means the item will be displayed smaller than
7899 normal, and a scale of greater than 1 means the item will be
7900 displayed larger than normal. A negative scale means the item will
7901 be mirrored.
7902
7903 By default, items are displayed at a scale of 1 (i.e. at their
7904 normal size).
7905
7906 Scaling is from the item's transformOrigin.
7907*/
7908
7909/*!
7910 \fn void QGraphicsObject::scaleChanged()
7911
7912 This signal is emitted when the scale of the item changes.
7913*/
7914
7915
7916/*!
7917 \property QGraphicsObject::enabled
7918 \brief whether the item is enabled or not
7919
7920 This property is declared in QGraphicsItem.
7921
7922 By default, this property is \c true.
7923
7924 \sa QGraphicsItem::isEnabled(), QGraphicsItem::setEnabled()
7925*/
7926
7927/*!
7928 \fn void QGraphicsObject::enabledChanged()
7929
7930 This signal gets emitted whenever the item gets enabled or disabled.
7931
7932 \sa isEnabled()
7933*/
7934
7935/*!
7936 \property QGraphicsObject::visible
7937 \brief whether the item is visible or not
7938
7939 This property is declared in QGraphicsItem.
7940
7941 By default, this property is \c true.
7942
7943 \sa QGraphicsItem::isVisible(), QGraphicsItem::setVisible()
7944*/
7945
7946/*!
7947 \fn QGraphicsObject::visibleChanged()
7948
7949 This signal gets emitted whenever the visibility of the item changes
7950
7951 \sa visible
7952*/
7953
7954/*!
7955 \property QGraphicsObject::transformOriginPoint
7956 \brief the transformation origin
7957
7958 This property sets a specific point in the item's coordinate system as the
7959 origin for scale and rotation.
7960
7961 \sa scale, rotation, QGraphicsItem::transformOriginPoint()
7962*/
7963
7964/*!
7965 \fn void QGraphicsObject::widthChanged()
7966 \internal
7967*/
7968
7969/*!
7970 \fn void QGraphicsObject::heightChanged()
7971 \internal
7972*/
7973
7974/*!
7975
7976 \fn QGraphicsObject::childrenChanged()
7977
7978 This signal gets emitted whenever the children list changes
7979 \internal
7980*/
7981
7982/*!
7983 \property QGraphicsObject::effect
7984 \since 4.7
7985 \brief the effect attached to this item
7986
7987 \sa QGraphicsItem::setGraphicsEffect(), QGraphicsItem::graphicsEffect()
7988*/

7990/*!
7991 \class QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem
7992 \brief The QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem class provides a common base for
7993 all path items.
7994 \since 4.2
7995 \ingroup graphicsview-api
7996 \inmodule QtWidgets
7997
7998 This class does not fully implement an item by itself; in particular, it
7999 does not implement boundingRect() and paint(), which are inherited by
8000 QGraphicsItem.
8001
8002 You can subclass this item to provide a simple base implementation of
8003 accessors for the item's pen and brush.
8004
8005 \sa QGraphicsRectItem, QGraphicsEllipseItem, QGraphicsPathItem,
8006 QGraphicsPolygonItem, QGraphicsTextItem, QGraphicsLineItem,
8007 QGraphicsPixmapItem, {Graphics View Framework}
8008*/
8009
8010class QAbstractGraphicsShapeItemPrivate : public QGraphicsItemPrivate
8011{
8012 Q_DECLARE_PUBLIC(QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem)
8013public:
8014
8015 QBrush brush;
8016 QPen pen;
8017
8018 // Cached bounding rectangle
8019 mutable QRectF boundingRect;
8020};
8021
8022/*!
8023 Constructs a QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem. \a parent is passed to
8024 QGraphicsItem's constructor.
8025*/
8026QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem(QGraphicsItem *parent)
8027 : QGraphicsItem(*new QAbstractGraphicsShapeItemPrivate, parent)
8028{
8029}
8030
8031/*!
8032 \internal
8033*/
8034QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem(QAbstractGraphicsShapeItemPrivate &dd, QGraphicsItem *parent)
8035 : QGraphicsItem(dd, parent)
8036{
8037}
8038
8039/*!
8040 Destroys a QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem.
8041*/
8042QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::~QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem()
8043{
8044}
8045
8046/*!
8047 Returns the item's pen. If no pen has been set, this function returns
8048 QPen(), a default black solid line pen with 1 width.
8049*/
8050QPen QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::pen() const
8051{
8052 Q_D(const QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem);
8053 return d->pen;
8054}
8055
8056/*!
8057 Sets the pen for this item to \a pen.
8058
8059 The pen is used to draw the item's outline.
8060
8061 \sa pen()
8062*/
8063void QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::setPen(const QPen &pen)
8064{
8065 Q_D(QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem);
8066 if (d->pen == pen)
8067 return;
8068 prepareGeometryChange();
8069 d->pen = pen;
8070 d->boundingRect = QRectF();
8071 update();
8072}
8073
8074/*!
8075 Returns the item's brush, or an empty brush if no brush has been set.
8076
8077 \sa setBrush()
8078*/
8079QBrush QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::brush() const
8080{
8081 Q_D(const QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem);
8082 return d->brush;
8083}
8084
8085/*!
8086 Sets the item's brush to \a brush.
8087
8088 The item's brush is used to fill the item.
8089
8090 If you use a brush with a QGradient, the gradient
8091 is relative to the item's coordinate system.
8092
8093 \sa brush()
8094*/
8095void QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::setBrush(const QBrush &brush)
8096{
8097 Q_D(QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem);
8098 if (d->brush == brush)
8099 return;
8100 d->brush = brush;
8101 update();
8102}
8103
8104/*!
8105 \reimp
8106*/
8107bool QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::isObscuredBy(const QGraphicsItem *item) const
8108{
8109 return QGraphicsItem::isObscuredBy(item);
8110}
8111
8112/*!
8113 \reimp
8114*/
8115QPainterPath QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::opaqueArea() const
8116{
8117 Q_D(const QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem);
8118 if (d->brush.isOpaque())
8119 return isClipped() ? clipPath() : shape();
8120 return QGraphicsItem::opaqueArea();
8121}
8122
8123/*!
8124 \class QGraphicsPathItem
8125 \brief The QGraphicsPathItem class provides a path item that you
8126 can add to a QGraphicsScene.
8127 \since 4.2
8128 \ingroup graphicsview-api
8129 \inmodule QtWidgets
8130
8131 To set the item's path, pass a QPainterPath to QGraphicsPathItem's
8132 constructor, or call the setPath() function. The path() function
8133 returns the current path.
8134
8135 \image graphicsview-pathitem.png
8136
8137 QGraphicsPathItem uses the path to provide a reasonable
8138 implementation of boundingRect(), shape(), and contains(). The
8139 paint() function draws the path using the item's associated pen
8140 and brush, which you can set by calling the setPen() and
8141 setBrush() functions.
8142
8143 \sa QGraphicsRectItem, QGraphicsEllipseItem, QGraphicsPolygonItem,
8144 QGraphicsTextItem, QGraphicsLineItem, QGraphicsPixmapItem, {Graphics
8145 View Framework}
8146*/
8147
8148class QGraphicsPathItemPrivate : public QAbstractGraphicsShapeItemPrivate
8149{
8150 Q_DECLARE_PUBLIC(QGraphicsPathItem)
8151public:
8152 QPainterPath path;
8153};
8154
8155/*!
8156 Constructs a QGraphicsPath item using \a path as the default path. \a
8157 parent is passed to QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem's constructor.
8158
8159 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
8160*/
8161QGraphicsPathItem::QGraphicsPathItem(const QPainterPath &path,
8162 QGraphicsItem *parent)
8163 : QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem(*new QGraphicsPathItemPrivate, parent)
8164{
8165 if (!path.isEmpty())
8166 setPath(path);
8167}
8168
8169/*!
8170 Constructs a QGraphicsPath. \a parent is passed to
8171 QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem's constructor.
8172
8173 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
8174*/
8175QGraphicsPathItem::QGraphicsPathItem(QGraphicsItem *parent)
8176 : QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem(*new QGraphicsPathItemPrivate, parent)
8177{
8178}
8179
8180/*!
8181 Destroys the QGraphicsPathItem.
8182*/
8183QGraphicsPathItem::~QGraphicsPathItem()
8184{
8185}
8186
8187/*!
8188 Returns the item's path as a QPainterPath. If no item has been set, an
8189 empty QPainterPath is returned.
8190
8191 \sa setPath()
8192*/
8193QPainterPath QGraphicsPathItem::path() const
8194{
8195 Q_D(const QGraphicsPathItem);
8196 return d->path;
8197}
8198
8199/*!
8200 Sets the item's path to be the given \a path.
8201
8202 \sa path()
8203*/
8204void QGraphicsPathItem::setPath(const QPainterPath &path)
8205{
8206 Q_D(QGraphicsPathItem);
8207 if (d->path == path)
8208 return;
8209 prepareGeometryChange();
8210 d->path = path;
8211 d->boundingRect = QRectF();
8212 update();
8213}
8214
8215/*!
8216 \reimp
8217*/
8218QRectF QGraphicsPathItem::boundingRect() const
8219{
8220 Q_D(const QGraphicsPathItem);
8221 if (d->boundingRect.isNull()) {
8222 qreal pw = pen().style() == Qt::NoPen ? qreal(0) : pen().widthF();
8223 if (pw == 0.0)
8224 d->boundingRect = d->path.controlPointRect();
8225 else {
8226 d->boundingRect = shape().controlPointRect();
8227 }
8228 }
8229 return d->boundingRect;
8230}
8231
8232/*!
8233 \reimp
8234*/
8235QPainterPath QGraphicsPathItem::shape() const
8236{
8237 Q_D(const QGraphicsPathItem);
8238 return qt_graphicsItem_shapeFromPath(path: d->path, pen: d->pen);
8239}
8240
8241/*!
8242 \reimp
8243*/
8244bool QGraphicsPathItem::contains(const QPointF &point) const
8245{
8246 return QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::contains(point);
8247}
8248
8249/*!
8250 \reimp
8251*/
8252void QGraphicsPathItem::paint(QPainter *painter, const QStyleOptionGraphicsItem *option,
8253 QWidget *widget)
8254{
8255 Q_D(QGraphicsPathItem);
8256 Q_UNUSED(widget);
8257 painter->setPen(d->pen);
8258 painter->setBrush(d->brush);
8259 painter->drawPath(path: d->path);
8260
8261 if (option->state & QStyle::State_Selected)
8262 qt_graphicsItem_highlightSelected(item: this, painter, option);
8263}
8264
8265/*!
8266 \reimp
8267*/
8268bool QGraphicsPathItem::isObscuredBy(const QGraphicsItem *item) const
8269{
8270 return QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::isObscuredBy(item);
8271}
8272
8273/*!
8274 \reimp
8275*/
8276QPainterPath QGraphicsPathItem::opaqueArea() const
8277{
8278 return QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::opaqueArea();
8279}
8280
8281/*!
8282 \reimp
8283*/
8284int QGraphicsPathItem::type() const
8285{
8286 return Type;
8287}
8288
8289/*!
8290 \internal
8291*/
8292bool QGraphicsPathItem::supportsExtension(Extension extension) const
8293{
8294 Q_UNUSED(extension);
8295 return false;
8296}
8297
8298/*!
8299 \internal
8300*/
8301void QGraphicsPathItem::setExtension(Extension extension, const QVariant &variant)
8302{
8303 Q_UNUSED(extension);
8304 Q_UNUSED(variant);
8305}
8306
8307/*!
8308 \internal
8309*/
8310QVariant QGraphicsPathItem::extension(const QVariant &variant) const
8311{
8312 Q_UNUSED(variant);
8313 return QVariant();
8314}
8315
8316/*!
8317 \class QGraphicsRectItem
8318 \brief The QGraphicsRectItem class provides a rectangle item that you
8319 can add to a QGraphicsScene.
8320 \since 4.2
8321 \ingroup graphicsview-api
8322 \inmodule QtWidgets
8323
8324 To set the item's rectangle, pass a QRectF to QGraphicsRectItem's
8325 constructor, or call the setRect() function. The rect() function
8326 returns the current rectangle.
8327
8328 \image graphicsview-rectitem.png
8329
8330 QGraphicsRectItem uses the rectangle and the pen width to provide
8331 a reasonable implementation of boundingRect(), shape(), and
8332 contains(). The paint() function draws the rectangle using the
8333 item's associated pen and brush, which you can set by calling the
8334 setPen() and setBrush() functions.
8335
8336 \note The rendering of invalid rectangles, such as those with negative
8337 widths or heights, is undefined. If you cannot be sure that you are
8338 using valid rectangles (for example, if you are creating
8339 rectangles using data from an unreliable source) then you should
8340 use QRectF::normalized() to create normalized rectangles, and use
8341 those instead.
8342
8343 \sa QGraphicsPathItem, QGraphicsEllipseItem, QGraphicsPolygonItem,
8344 QGraphicsTextItem, QGraphicsLineItem, QGraphicsPixmapItem, {Graphics
8345 View Framework}
8346*/
8347
8348class QGraphicsRectItemPrivate : public QAbstractGraphicsShapeItemPrivate
8349{
8350 Q_DECLARE_PUBLIC(QGraphicsRectItem)
8351public:
8352 QRectF rect;
8353};
8354
8355/*!
8356 Constructs a QGraphicsRectItem, using \a rect as the default rectangle.
8357 \a parent is passed to QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem's constructor.
8358
8359 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
8360*/
8361QGraphicsRectItem::QGraphicsRectItem(const QRectF &rect, QGraphicsItem *parent)
8362 : QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem(*new QGraphicsRectItemPrivate, parent)
8363{
8364 setRect(rect);
8365}
8366
8367/*!
8368 \fn QGraphicsRectItem::QGraphicsRectItem(qreal x, qreal y, qreal width, qreal height,
8369 QGraphicsItem *parent)
8370
8371 Constructs a QGraphicsRectItem with a default rectangle defined
8372 by (\a x, \a y) and the given \a width and \a height.
8373
8374 \a parent is passed to QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem's constructor.
8375
8376 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
8377*/
8378QGraphicsRectItem::QGraphicsRectItem(qreal x, qreal y, qreal w, qreal h,
8379 QGraphicsItem *parent)
8380 : QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem(*new QGraphicsRectItemPrivate, parent)
8381{
8382 setRect(QRectF(x, y, w, h));
8383}
8384
8385/*!
8386 Constructs a QGraphicsRectItem. \a parent is passed to
8387 QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem's constructor.
8388
8389 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
8390*/
8391QGraphicsRectItem::QGraphicsRectItem(QGraphicsItem *parent)
8392 : QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem(*new QGraphicsRectItemPrivate, parent)
8393{
8394}
8395
8396/*!
8397 Destroys the QGraphicsRectItem.
8398*/
8399QGraphicsRectItem::~QGraphicsRectItem()
8400{
8401}
8402
8403/*!
8404 Returns the item's rectangle.
8405
8406 \sa setRect()
8407*/
8408QRectF QGraphicsRectItem::rect() const
8409{
8410 Q_D(const QGraphicsRectItem);
8411 return d->rect;
8412}
8413
8414/*!
8415 \fn void QGraphicsRectItem::setRect(const QRectF &rectangle)
8416
8417 Sets the item's rectangle to be the given \a rectangle.
8418
8419 \sa rect()
8420*/
8421void QGraphicsRectItem::setRect(const QRectF &rect)
8422{
8423 Q_D(QGraphicsRectItem);
8424 if (d->rect == rect)
8425 return;
8426 prepareGeometryChange();
8427 d->rect = rect;
8428 d->boundingRect = QRectF();
8429 update();
8430}
8431
8432/*!
8433 \fn void QGraphicsRectItem::setRect(qreal x, qreal y, qreal width, qreal height)
8434 \fn void QGraphicsEllipseItem::setRect(qreal x, qreal y, qreal width, qreal height)
8435
8436 Sets the item's rectangle to the rectangle defined by (\a x, \a y)
8437 and the given \a width and \a height.
8438
8439 This convenience function is equivalent to calling \c
8440 {setRect(QRectF(x, y, width, height))}
8441
8442 \sa rect()
8443*/
8444
8445/*!
8446 \reimp
8447*/
8448QRectF QGraphicsRectItem::boundingRect() const
8449{
8450 Q_D(const QGraphicsRectItem);
8451 if (d->boundingRect.isNull()) {
8452 qreal halfpw = pen().style() == Qt::NoPen ? qreal(0) : pen().widthF() / 2;
8453 d->boundingRect = d->rect;
8454 if (halfpw > 0.0)
8455 d->boundingRect.adjust(xp1: -halfpw, yp1: -halfpw, xp2: halfpw, yp2: halfpw);
8456 }
8457 return d->boundingRect;
8458}
8459
8460/*!
8461 \reimp
8462*/
8463QPainterPath QGraphicsRectItem::shape() const
8464{
8465 Q_D(const QGraphicsRectItem);
8466 QPainterPath path;
8467 path.addRect(rect: d->rect);
8468 return qt_graphicsItem_shapeFromPath(path, pen: d->pen);
8469}
8470
8471/*!
8472 \reimp
8473*/
8474bool QGraphicsRectItem::contains(const QPointF &point) const
8475{
8476 return QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::contains(point);
8477}
8478
8479/*!
8480 \reimp
8481*/
8482void QGraphicsRectItem::paint(QPainter *painter, const QStyleOptionGraphicsItem *option,
8483 QWidget *widget)
8484{
8485 Q_D(QGraphicsRectItem);
8486 Q_UNUSED(widget);
8487 painter->setPen(d->pen);
8488 painter->setBrush(d->brush);
8489 painter->drawRect(rect: d->rect);
8490
8491 if (option->state & QStyle::State_Selected)
8492 qt_graphicsItem_highlightSelected(item: this, painter, option);
8493}
8494
8495/*!
8496 \reimp
8497*/
8498bool QGraphicsRectItem::isObscuredBy(const QGraphicsItem *item) const
8499{
8500 return QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::isObscuredBy(item);
8501}
8502
8503/*!
8504 \reimp
8505*/
8506QPainterPath QGraphicsRectItem::opaqueArea() const
8507{
8508 return QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::opaqueArea();
8509}
8510
8511/*!
8512 \reimp
8513*/
8514int QGraphicsRectItem::type() const
8515{
8516 return Type;
8517}
8518
8519/*!
8520 \internal
8521*/
8522bool QGraphicsRectItem::supportsExtension(Extension extension) const
8523{
8524 Q_UNUSED(extension);
8525 return false;
8526}
8527
8528/*!
8529 \internal
8530*/
8531void QGraphicsRectItem::setExtension(Extension extension, const QVariant &variant)
8532{
8533 Q_UNUSED(extension);
8534 Q_UNUSED(variant);
8535}
8536
8537/*!
8538 \internal
8539*/
8540QVariant QGraphicsRectItem::extension(const QVariant &variant) const
8541{
8542 Q_UNUSED(variant);
8543 return QVariant();
8544}
8545
8546/*!
8547 \class QGraphicsEllipseItem
8548 \brief The QGraphicsEllipseItem class provides an ellipse item that you
8549 can add to a QGraphicsScene.
8550 \since 4.2
8551 \ingroup graphicsview-api
8552 \inmodule QtWidgets
8553
8554 QGraphicsEllipseItem respresents an ellipse with a fill and an outline,
8555 and you can also use it for ellipse segments (see startAngle(),
8556 spanAngle()).
8557
8558 \table
8559 \row
8560 \li \inlineimage graphicsview-ellipseitem.png
8561 \li \inlineimage graphicsview-ellipseitem-pie.png
8562 \endtable
8563
8564 To set the item's ellipse, pass a QRectF to QGraphicsEllipseItem's
8565 constructor, or call setRect(). The rect() function returns the
8566 current ellipse geometry.
8567
8568 QGraphicsEllipseItem uses the rect and the pen width to provide a
8569 reasonable implementation of boundingRect(), shape(), and contains(). The
8570 paint() function draws the ellipse using the item's associated pen and
8571 brush, which you can set by calling setPen() and setBrush().
8572
8573 \sa QGraphicsPathItem, QGraphicsRectItem, QGraphicsPolygonItem,
8574 QGraphicsTextItem, QGraphicsLineItem, QGraphicsPixmapItem, {Graphics
8575 View Framework}
8576*/
8577
8578class QGraphicsEllipseItemPrivate : public QAbstractGraphicsShapeItemPrivate
8579{
8580 Q_DECLARE_PUBLIC(QGraphicsEllipseItem)
8581public:
8582 inline QGraphicsEllipseItemPrivate()
8583 : startAngle(0), spanAngle(360 * 16)
8584 { }
8585
8586 QRectF rect;
8587 int startAngle;
8588 int spanAngle;
8589};
8590
8591/*!
8592 Constructs a QGraphicsEllipseItem using \a rect as the default rectangle.
8593 \a parent is passed to QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem's constructor.
8594
8595 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
8596*/
8597QGraphicsEllipseItem::QGraphicsEllipseItem(const QRectF &rect, QGraphicsItem *parent)
8598 : QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem(*new QGraphicsEllipseItemPrivate, parent)
8599{
8600 setRect(rect);
8601}
8602
8603/*!
8604 \fn QGraphicsEllipseItem::QGraphicsEllipseItem(qreal x, qreal y, qreal width, qreal height, QGraphicsItem *parent)
8605 \since 4.3
8606
8607 Constructs a QGraphicsEllipseItem using the rectangle defined by (\a x, \a
8608 y) and the given \a width and \a height, as the default rectangle. \a
8609 parent is passed to QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem's constructor.
8610
8611 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
8612*/
8613QGraphicsEllipseItem::QGraphicsEllipseItem(qreal x, qreal y, qreal w, qreal h,
8614 QGraphicsItem *parent)
8615 : QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem(*new QGraphicsEllipseItemPrivate, parent)
8616{
8617 setRect(ax: x,ay: y,w,h);
8618}
8619
8620
8621
8622/*!
8623 Constructs a QGraphicsEllipseItem. \a parent is passed to
8624 QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem's constructor.
8625
8626 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
8627*/
8628QGraphicsEllipseItem::QGraphicsEllipseItem(QGraphicsItem *parent)
8629 : QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem(*new QGraphicsEllipseItemPrivate, parent)
8630{
8631}
8632
8633/*!
8634 Destroys the QGraphicsEllipseItem.
8635*/
8636QGraphicsEllipseItem::~QGraphicsEllipseItem()
8637{
8638}
8639
8640/*!
8641 Returns the item's ellipse geometry as a QRectF.
8642
8643 \sa setRect(), QPainter::drawEllipse()
8644*/
8645QRectF QGraphicsEllipseItem::rect() const
8646{
8647 Q_D(const QGraphicsEllipseItem);
8648 return d->rect;
8649}
8650
8651/*!
8652 Sets the item's ellipse geometry to \a rect. The rectangle's left edge
8653 defines the left edge of the ellipse, and the rectangle's top edge
8654 describes the top of the ellipse. The height and width of the rectangle
8655 describe the height and width of the ellipse.
8656
8657 \sa rect(), QPainter::drawEllipse()
8658*/
8659void QGraphicsEllipseItem::setRect(const QRectF &rect)
8660{
8661 Q_D(QGraphicsEllipseItem);
8662 if (d->rect == rect)
8663 return;
8664 prepareGeometryChange();
8665 d->rect = rect;
8666 d->boundingRect = QRectF();
8667 update();
8668}
8669
8670/*!
8671 Returns the start angle for an ellipse segment in 16ths of a degree. This
8672 angle is used together with spanAngle() for representing an ellipse
8673 segment (a pie). By default, the start angle is 0.
8674
8675 \sa setStartAngle(), spanAngle()
8676*/
8677int QGraphicsEllipseItem::startAngle() const
8678{
8679 Q_D(const QGraphicsEllipseItem);
8680 return d->startAngle;
8681}
8682
8683/*!
8684 Sets the start angle for an ellipse segment to \a angle, which is in 16ths
8685 of a degree. This angle is used together with spanAngle() for representing
8686 an ellipse segment (a pie). By default, the start angle is 0.
8687
8688 \sa startAngle(), setSpanAngle(), QPainter::drawPie()
8689*/
8690void QGraphicsEllipseItem::setStartAngle(int angle)
8691{
8692 Q_D(QGraphicsEllipseItem);
8693 if (angle != d->startAngle) {
8694 prepareGeometryChange();
8695 d->boundingRect = QRectF();
8696 d->startAngle = angle;
8697 update();
8698 }
8699}
8700
8701/*!
8702 Returns the span angle of an ellipse segment in 16ths of a degree. This
8703 angle is used together with startAngle() for representing an ellipse
8704 segment (a pie). By default, this function returns 5760 (360 * 16, a full
8705 ellipse).
8706
8707 \sa setSpanAngle(), startAngle()
8708*/
8709int QGraphicsEllipseItem::spanAngle() const
8710{
8711 Q_D(const QGraphicsEllipseItem);
8712 return d->spanAngle;
8713}
8714
8715/*!
8716 Sets the span angle for an ellipse segment to \a angle, which is in 16ths
8717 of a degree. This angle is used together with startAngle() to represent an
8718 ellipse segment (a pie). By default, the span angle is 5760 (360 * 16, a
8719 full ellipse).
8720
8721 \sa spanAngle(), setStartAngle(), QPainter::drawPie()
8722*/
8723void QGraphicsEllipseItem::setSpanAngle(int angle)
8724{
8725 Q_D(QGraphicsEllipseItem);
8726 if (angle != d->spanAngle) {
8727 prepareGeometryChange();
8728 d->boundingRect = QRectF();
8729 d->spanAngle = angle;
8730 update();
8731 }
8732}
8733
8734/*!
8735 \reimp
8736*/
8737QRectF QGraphicsEllipseItem::boundingRect() const
8738{
8739 Q_D(const QGraphicsEllipseItem);
8740 if (d->boundingRect.isNull()) {
8741 qreal pw = pen().style() == Qt::NoPen ? qreal(0) : pen().widthF();
8742 if (pw == 0.0 && d->spanAngle == 360 * 16)
8743 d->boundingRect = d->rect;
8744 else
8745 d->boundingRect = shape().controlPointRect();
8746 }
8747 return d->boundingRect;
8748}
8749
8750/*!
8751 \reimp
8752*/
8753QPainterPath QGraphicsEllipseItem::shape() const
8754{
8755 Q_D(const QGraphicsEllipseItem);
8756 QPainterPath path;
8757 if (d->rect.isNull())
8758 return path;
8759 if (d->spanAngle != 360 * 16) {
8760 path.moveTo(p: d->rect.center());
8761 path.arcTo(rect: d->rect, startAngle: d->startAngle / 16.0, arcLength: d->spanAngle / 16.0);
8762 } else {
8763 path.addEllipse(rect: d->rect);
8764 }
8765
8766 return qt_graphicsItem_shapeFromPath(path, pen: d->pen);
8767}
8768
8769/*!
8770 \reimp
8771*/
8772bool QGraphicsEllipseItem::contains(const QPointF &point) const
8773{
8774 return QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::contains(point);
8775}
8776
8777/*!
8778 \reimp
8779*/
8780void QGraphicsEllipseItem::paint(QPainter *painter, const QStyleOptionGraphicsItem *option,
8781 QWidget *widget)
8782{
8783 Q_D(QGraphicsEllipseItem);
8784 Q_UNUSED(widget);
8785 painter->setPen(d->pen);
8786 painter->setBrush(d->brush);
8787 if ((d->spanAngle != 0) && (qAbs(t: d->spanAngle) % (360 * 16) == 0))
8788 painter->drawEllipse(r: d->rect);
8789 else
8790 painter->drawPie(rect: d->rect, a: d->startAngle, alen: d->spanAngle);
8791
8792 if (option->state & QStyle::State_Selected)
8793 qt_graphicsItem_highlightSelected(item: this, painter, option);
8794}
8795
8796/*!
8797 \reimp
8798*/
8799bool QGraphicsEllipseItem::isObscuredBy(const QGraphicsItem *item) const
8800{
8801 return QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::isObscuredBy(item);
8802}
8803
8804/*!
8805 \reimp
8806*/
8807QPainterPath QGraphicsEllipseItem::opaqueArea() const
8808{
8809 return QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::opaqueArea();
8810}
8811
8812/*!
8813 \reimp
8814*/
8815int QGraphicsEllipseItem::type() const
8816{
8817 return Type;
8818}
8819
8820
8821/*!
8822 \internal
8823*/
8824bool QGraphicsEllipseItem::supportsExtension(Extension extension) const
8825{
8826 Q_UNUSED(extension);
8827 return false;
8828}
8829
8830/*!
8831 \internal
8832*/
8833void QGraphicsEllipseItem::setExtension(Extension extension, const QVariant &variant)
8834{
8835 Q_UNUSED(extension);
8836 Q_UNUSED(variant);
8837}
8838
8839/*!
8840 \internal
8841*/
8842QVariant QGraphicsEllipseItem::extension(const QVariant &variant) const
8843{
8844 Q_UNUSED(variant);
8845 return QVariant();
8846}
8847
8848/*!
8849 \class QGraphicsPolygonItem
8850 \brief The QGraphicsPolygonItem class provides a polygon item that you
8851 can add to a QGraphicsScene.
8852 \since 4.2
8853 \ingroup graphicsview-api
8854 \inmodule QtWidgets
8855
8856 To set the item's polygon, pass a QPolygonF to
8857 QGraphicsPolygonItem's constructor, or call the setPolygon()
8858 function. The polygon() function returns the current polygon.
8859
8860 \image graphicsview-polygonitem.png
8861
8862 QGraphicsPolygonItem uses the polygon and the pen width to provide
8863 a reasonable implementation of boundingRect(), shape(), and
8864 contains(). The paint() function draws the polygon using the
8865 item's associated pen and brush, which you can set by calling the
8866 setPen() and setBrush() functions.
8867
8868 \sa QGraphicsPathItem, QGraphicsRectItem, QGraphicsEllipseItem,
8869 QGraphicsTextItem, QGraphicsLineItem, QGraphicsPixmapItem, {Graphics
8870 View Framework}
8871*/
8872
8873class QGraphicsPolygonItemPrivate : public QAbstractGraphicsShapeItemPrivate
8874{
8875 Q_DECLARE_PUBLIC(QGraphicsPolygonItem)
8876public:
8877 inline QGraphicsPolygonItemPrivate()
8878 : fillRule(Qt::OddEvenFill)
8879 { }
8880
8881 QPolygonF polygon;
8882 Qt::FillRule fillRule;
8883};
8884
8885/*!
8886 Constructs a QGraphicsPolygonItem with \a polygon as the default
8887 polygon. \a parent is passed to QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem's constructor.
8888
8889 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
8890*/
8891QGraphicsPolygonItem::QGraphicsPolygonItem(const QPolygonF &polygon, QGraphicsItem *parent)
8892 : QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem(*new QGraphicsPolygonItemPrivate, parent)
8893{
8894 setPolygon(polygon);
8895}
8896
8897/*!
8898 Constructs a QGraphicsPolygonItem. \a parent is passed to
8899 QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem's constructor.
8900
8901 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
8902*/
8903QGraphicsPolygonItem::QGraphicsPolygonItem(QGraphicsItem *parent)
8904 : QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem(*new QGraphicsPolygonItemPrivate, parent)
8905{
8906}
8907
8908/*!
8909 Destroys the QGraphicsPolygonItem.
8910*/
8911QGraphicsPolygonItem::~QGraphicsPolygonItem()
8912{
8913}
8914
8915/*!
8916 Returns the item's polygon, or an empty polygon if no polygon
8917 has been set.
8918
8919 \sa setPolygon()
8920*/
8921QPolygonF QGraphicsPolygonItem::polygon() const
8922{
8923 Q_D(const QGraphicsPolygonItem);
8924 return d->polygon;
8925}
8926
8927/*!
8928 Sets the item's polygon to be the given \a polygon.
8929
8930 \sa polygon()
8931*/
8932void QGraphicsPolygonItem::setPolygon(const QPolygonF &polygon)
8933{
8934 Q_D(QGraphicsPolygonItem);
8935 if (d->polygon == polygon)
8936 return;
8937 prepareGeometryChange();
8938 d->polygon = polygon;
8939 d->boundingRect = QRectF();
8940 update();
8941}
8942
8943/*!
8944 Returns the fill rule of the polygon. The default fill rule is
8945 Qt::OddEvenFill.
8946
8947 \sa setFillRule(), QPainterPath::fillRule(), QPainter::drawPolygon()
8948*/
8949Qt::FillRule QGraphicsPolygonItem::fillRule() const
8950{
8951 Q_D(const QGraphicsPolygonItem);
8952 return d->fillRule;
8953}
8954
8955/*!
8956 Sets the fill rule of the polygon to \a rule. The default fill rule is
8957 Qt::OddEvenFill.
8958
8959 \sa fillRule(), QPainterPath::fillRule(), QPainter::drawPolygon()
8960*/
8961void QGraphicsPolygonItem::setFillRule(Qt::FillRule rule)
8962{
8963 Q_D(QGraphicsPolygonItem);
8964 if (rule != d->fillRule) {
8965 d->fillRule = rule;
8966 update();
8967 }
8968}
8969
8970/*!
8971 \reimp
8972*/
8973QRectF QGraphicsPolygonItem::boundingRect() const
8974{
8975 Q_D(const QGraphicsPolygonItem);
8976 if (d->boundingRect.isNull()) {
8977 qreal pw = pen().style() == Qt::NoPen ? qreal(0) : pen().widthF();
8978 if (pw == 0.0)
8979 d->boundingRect = d->polygon.boundingRect();
8980 else
8981 d->boundingRect = shape().controlPointRect();
8982 }
8983 return d->boundingRect;
8984}
8985
8986/*!
8987 \reimp
8988*/
8989QPainterPath QGraphicsPolygonItem::shape() const
8990{
8991 Q_D(const QGraphicsPolygonItem);
8992 QPainterPath path;
8993 path.addPolygon(polygon: d->polygon);
8994 return qt_graphicsItem_shapeFromPath(path, pen: d->pen);
