8995}
8996
8997/*!
8998 \reimp
8999*/
9000bool QGraphicsPolygonItem::contains(const QPointF &point) const
9001{
9002 return QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::contains(point);
9003}
9004
9005/*!
9006 \reimp
9007*/
9008void QGraphicsPolygonItem::paint(QPainter *painter, const QStyleOptionGraphicsItem *option, QWidget *widget)
9009{
9010 Q_D(QGraphicsPolygonItem);
9011 Q_UNUSED(widget);
9012 painter->setPen(d->pen);
9013 painter->setBrush(d->brush);
9014 painter->drawPolygon(polygon: d->polygon, fillRule: d->fillRule);
9015
9016 if (option->state & QStyle::State_Selected)
9017 qt_graphicsItem_highlightSelected(item: this, painter, option);
9018}
9019
9020/*!
9021 \reimp
9022*/
9023bool QGraphicsPolygonItem::isObscuredBy(const QGraphicsItem *item) const
9024{
9025 return QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::isObscuredBy(item);
9026}
9027
9028/*!
9029 \reimp
9030*/
9031QPainterPath QGraphicsPolygonItem::opaqueArea() const
9032{
9033 return QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::opaqueArea();
9034}
9035
9036/*!
9037 \reimp
9038*/
9039int QGraphicsPolygonItem::type() const
9040{
9041 return Type;
9042}
9043
9044/*!
9045 \internal
9046*/
9047bool QGraphicsPolygonItem::supportsExtension(Extension extension) const
9048{
9049 Q_UNUSED(extension);
9050 return false;
9051}
9052
9053/*!
9054 \internal
9055*/
9056void QGraphicsPolygonItem::setExtension(Extension extension, const QVariant &variant)
9057{
9058 Q_UNUSED(extension);
9059 Q_UNUSED(variant);
9060}
9061
9062/*!
9063 \internal
9064*/
9065QVariant QGraphicsPolygonItem::extension(const QVariant &variant) const
9066{
9067 Q_UNUSED(variant);
9068 return QVariant();
9069}
9070
9071/*!
9072 \class QGraphicsLineItem
9073 \brief The QGraphicsLineItem class provides a line item that you can add to a
9074 QGraphicsScene.
9075 \since 4.2
9076 \ingroup graphicsview-api
9077 \inmodule QtWidgets
9078
9079 To set the item's line, pass a QLineF to QGraphicsLineItem's
9080 constructor, or call the setLine() function. The line() function
9081 returns the current line. By default the line is black with a
9082 width of 0, but you can change this by calling setPen().
9083
9084 \image graphicsview-lineitem.png
9085
9086 QGraphicsLineItem uses the line and the pen width to provide a reasonable
9087 implementation of boundingRect(), shape(), and contains(). The paint()
9088 function draws the line using the item's associated pen.
9089
9090 \sa QGraphicsPathItem, QGraphicsRectItem, QGraphicsEllipseItem,
9091 QGraphicsTextItem, QGraphicsPolygonItem, QGraphicsPixmapItem,
9092 {Graphics View Framework}
9093*/
9094
9095class QGraphicsLineItemPrivate : public QGraphicsItemPrivate
9096{
9097 Q_DECLARE_PUBLIC(QGraphicsLineItem)
9098public:
9099 QLineF line;
9100 QPen pen;
9101};
9102
9103/*!
9104 Constructs a QGraphicsLineItem, using \a line as the default line. \a
9105 parent is passed to QGraphicsItem's constructor.
9106
9107 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
9108*/
9109QGraphicsLineItem::QGraphicsLineItem(const QLineF &line, QGraphicsItem *parent)
9110 : QGraphicsItem(*new QGraphicsLineItemPrivate, parent)
9111{
9112 setLine(line);
9113}
9114
9115/*!
9116 Constructs a QGraphicsLineItem, using the line between (\a x1, \a y1) and
9117 (\a x2, \a y2) as the default line. \a parent is passed to
9118 QGraphicsItem's constructor.
9119
9120 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
9121*/
9122QGraphicsLineItem::QGraphicsLineItem(qreal x1, qreal y1, qreal x2, qreal y2, QGraphicsItem *parent)
9123 : QGraphicsItem(*new QGraphicsLineItemPrivate, parent)
9124{
9125 setLine(x1, y1, x2, y2);
9126}
9127
9128
9129
9130/*!
9131 Constructs a QGraphicsLineItem. \a parent is passed to QGraphicsItem's
9132 constructor.
9133
9134 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
9135*/
9136QGraphicsLineItem::QGraphicsLineItem(QGraphicsItem *parent)
9137 : QGraphicsItem(*new QGraphicsLineItemPrivate, parent)
9138{
9139}
9140
9141/*!
9142 Destroys the QGraphicsLineItem.
9143*/
9144QGraphicsLineItem::~QGraphicsLineItem()
9145{
9146}
9147
9148/*!
9149 Returns the item's pen, or a black solid 0-width pen if no pen has
9150 been set.
9151
9152 \sa setPen()
9153*/
9154QPen QGraphicsLineItem::pen() const
9155{
9156 Q_D(const QGraphicsLineItem);
9157 return d->pen;
9158}
9159
9160/*!
9161 Sets the item's pen to \a pen. If no pen is set, the line will be painted
9162 using a black solid 0-width pen.
9163
9164 \sa pen()
9165*/
9166void QGraphicsLineItem::setPen(const QPen &pen)
9167{
9168 Q_D(QGraphicsLineItem);
9169 if (d->pen == pen)
9170 return;
9171 prepareGeometryChange();
9172 d->pen = pen;
9173 update();
9174}
9175
9176/*!
9177 Returns the item's line, or a null line if no line has been set.
9178
9179 \sa setLine()
9180*/
9181QLineF QGraphicsLineItem::line() const
9182{
9183 Q_D(const QGraphicsLineItem);
9184 return d->line;
9185}
9186
9187/*!
9188 Sets the item's line to be the given \a line.
9189
9190 \sa line()
9191*/
9192void QGraphicsLineItem::setLine(const QLineF &line)
9193{
9194 Q_D(QGraphicsLineItem);
9195 if (d->line == line)
9196 return;
9197 prepareGeometryChange();
9198 d->line = line;
9199 update();
9200}
9201
9202/*!
9203 \fn void QGraphicsLineItem::setLine(qreal x1, qreal y1, qreal x2, qreal y2)
9204 \overload
9205
9206 Sets the item's line to be the line between (\a x1, \a y1) and (\a
9207 x2, \a y2).
9208
9209 This is the same as calling \c {setLine(QLineF(x1, y1, x2, y2))}.
9210*/
9211
9212/*!
9213 \reimp
9214*/
9215QRectF QGraphicsLineItem::boundingRect() const
9216{
9217 Q_D(const QGraphicsLineItem);
9218 if (d->pen.widthF() == 0.0) {
9219 const qreal x1 = d->line.p1().x();
9220 const qreal x2 = d->line.p2().x();
9221 const qreal y1 = d->line.p1().y();
9222 const qreal y2 = d->line.p2().y();
9223 qreal lx = qMin(a: x1, b: x2);
9224 qreal rx = qMax(a: x1, b: x2);
9225 qreal ty = qMin(a: y1, b: y2);
9226 qreal by = qMax(a: y1, b: y2);
9227 return QRectF(lx, ty, rx - lx, by - ty);
9228 }
9229 return shape().controlPointRect();
9230}
9231
9232/*!
9233 \reimp
9234*/
9235QPainterPath QGraphicsLineItem::shape() const
9236{
9237 Q_D(const QGraphicsLineItem);
9238 QPainterPath path;
9239 if (d->line == QLineF())
9240 return path;
9241
9242 path.moveTo(p: d->line.p1());
9243 path.lineTo(p: d->line.p2());
9244 return qt_graphicsItem_shapeFromPath(path, pen: d->pen);
9245}
9246
9247/*!
9248 \reimp
9249*/
9250bool QGraphicsLineItem::contains(const QPointF &point) const
9251{
9252 return QGraphicsItem::contains(point);
9253}
9254
9255/*!
9256 \reimp
9257*/
9258void QGraphicsLineItem::paint(QPainter *painter, const QStyleOptionGraphicsItem *option, QWidget *widget)
9259{
9260 Q_D(QGraphicsLineItem);
9261 Q_UNUSED(widget);
9262 painter->setPen(d->pen);
9263 painter->drawLine(l: d->line);
9264
9265 if (option->state & QStyle::State_Selected)
9266 qt_graphicsItem_highlightSelected(item: this, painter, option);
9267}
9268
9269/*!
9270 \reimp
9271*/
9272bool QGraphicsLineItem::isObscuredBy(const QGraphicsItem *item) const
9273{
9274 return QGraphicsItem::isObscuredBy(item);
9275}
9276
9277/*!
9278 \reimp
9279*/
9280QPainterPath QGraphicsLineItem::opaqueArea() const
9281{
9282 return QGraphicsItem::opaqueArea();
9283}
9284
9285/*!
9286 \reimp
9287*/
9288int QGraphicsLineItem::type() const
9289{
9290 return Type;
9291}
9292
9293/*!
9294 \internal
9295*/
9296bool QGraphicsLineItem::supportsExtension(Extension extension) const
9297{
9298 Q_UNUSED(extension);
9299 return false;
9300}
9301
9302/*!
9303 \internal
9304*/
9305void QGraphicsLineItem::setExtension(Extension extension, const QVariant &variant)
9306{
9307 Q_UNUSED(extension);
9308 Q_UNUSED(variant);
9309}
9310
9311/*!
9312 \internal
9313*/
9314QVariant QGraphicsLineItem::extension(const QVariant &variant) const
9315{
9316 Q_UNUSED(variant);
9317 return QVariant();
9318}
9319
9320/*!
9321 \class QGraphicsPixmapItem
9322 \brief The QGraphicsPixmapItem class provides a pixmap item that you can add to
9323 a QGraphicsScene.
9324 \since 4.2
9325 \ingroup graphicsview-api
9326 \inmodule QtWidgets
9327
9328 To set the item's pixmap, pass a QPixmap to QGraphicsPixmapItem's
9329 constructor, or call the setPixmap() function. The pixmap()
9330 function returns the current pixmap.
9331
9332 QGraphicsPixmapItem uses pixmap's optional alpha mask to provide a
9333 reasonable implementation of boundingRect(), shape(), and contains().
9334
9335 \image graphicsview-pixmapitem.png
9336
9337 The pixmap is drawn at the item's (0, 0) coordinate, as returned by
9338 offset(). You can change the drawing offset by calling setOffset().
9339
9340 You can set the pixmap's transformation mode by calling
9341 setTransformationMode(). By default, Qt::FastTransformation is used, which
9342 provides fast, non-smooth scaling. Qt::SmoothTransformation enables
9343 QPainter::SmoothPixmapTransform on the painter, and the quality depends on
9344 the platform and viewport. The result is usually not as good as calling
9345 QPixmap::scale() directly. Call transformationMode() to get the current
9346 transformation mode for the item.
9347
9348 \sa QGraphicsPathItem, QGraphicsRectItem, QGraphicsEllipseItem,
9349 QGraphicsTextItem, QGraphicsPolygonItem, QGraphicsLineItem,
9350 {Graphics View Framework}
9351*/
9352
9353/*!
9354 \enum QGraphicsPixmapItem::ShapeMode
9355
9356 This enum describes how QGraphicsPixmapItem calculates its shape and
9357 opaque area.
9358
9359 The default value is MaskShape.
9360
9361 \value MaskShape The shape is determined by calling QPixmap::mask().
9362 This shape includes only the opaque pixels of the pixmap.
9363 Because the shape is more complex, however, it can be slower than the other modes,
9364 and uses more memory.
9365
9366 \value BoundingRectShape The shape is determined by tracing the outline of
9367 the pixmap. This is the fastest shape mode, but it does not take into account
9368 any transparent areas on the pixmap.
9369
9370 \value HeuristicMaskShape The shape is determine by calling
9371 QPixmap::createHeuristicMask(). The performance and memory consumption
9372 is similar to MaskShape.
9373*/
9374extern QPainterPath qt_regionToPath(const QRegion &region);
9375
9376class QGraphicsPixmapItemPrivate : public QGraphicsItemPrivate
9377{
9378 Q_DECLARE_PUBLIC(QGraphicsPixmapItem)
9379public:
9380 QGraphicsPixmapItemPrivate()
9381 : transformationMode(Qt::FastTransformation),
9382 shapeMode(QGraphicsPixmapItem::MaskShape),
9383 hasShape(false)
9384 {}
9385
9386 QPixmap pixmap;
9387 Qt::TransformationMode transformationMode;
9388 QPointF offset;
9389 QGraphicsPixmapItem::ShapeMode shapeMode;
9390 QPainterPath shape;
9391 bool hasShape;
9392
9393 void updateShape()
9394 {
9395 shape = QPainterPath();
9396 switch (shapeMode) {
9397 case QGraphicsPixmapItem::MaskShape: {
9398 QBitmap mask = pixmap.mask();
9399 if (!mask.isNull()) {
9400 shape = qt_regionToPath(region: QRegion(mask).translated(p: offset.toPoint()));
9401 break;
9402 }
9403 Q_FALLTHROUGH();
9404 }
9405 case QGraphicsPixmapItem::BoundingRectShape:
9406 shape.addRect(rect: QRectF(offset.x(), offset.y(), pixmap.width(), pixmap.height()));
9407 break;
9408 case QGraphicsPixmapItem::HeuristicMaskShape:
9409#ifndef QT_NO_IMAGE_HEURISTIC_MASK
9410 shape = qt_regionToPath(region: QRegion(pixmap.createHeuristicMask()).translated(p: offset.toPoint()));
9411#else
9412 shape.addRect(QRectF(offset.x(), offset.y(), pixmap.width(), pixmap.height()));
9413#endif
9414 break;
9415 }
9416 }
9417};
9418
9419/*!
9420 Constructs a QGraphicsPixmapItem, using \a pixmap as the default pixmap.
9421 \a parent is passed to QGraphicsItem's constructor.
9422
9423 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
9424*/
9425QGraphicsPixmapItem::QGraphicsPixmapItem(const QPixmap &pixmap, QGraphicsItem *parent)
9426 : QGraphicsItem(*new QGraphicsPixmapItemPrivate, parent)
9427{
9428 setPixmap(pixmap);
9429}
9430
9431/*!
9432 Constructs a QGraphicsPixmapItem. \a parent is passed to QGraphicsItem's
9433 constructor.
9434
9435 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
9436*/
9437QGraphicsPixmapItem::QGraphicsPixmapItem(QGraphicsItem *parent)
9438 : QGraphicsItem(*new QGraphicsPixmapItemPrivate, parent)
9439{
9440}
9441
9442/*!
9443 Destroys the QGraphicsPixmapItem.
9444*/
9445QGraphicsPixmapItem::~QGraphicsPixmapItem()
9446{
9447}
9448
9449/*!
9450 Sets the item's pixmap to \a pixmap.
9451
9452 \sa pixmap()
9453*/
9454void QGraphicsPixmapItem::setPixmap(const QPixmap &pixmap)
9455{
9456 Q_D(QGraphicsPixmapItem);
9457 prepareGeometryChange();
9458 d->pixmap = pixmap;
9459 d->hasShape = false;
9460 update();
9461}
9462
9463/*!
9464 Returns the item's pixmap, or an invalid QPixmap if no pixmap has been
9465 set.
9466
9467 \sa setPixmap()
9468*/
9469QPixmap QGraphicsPixmapItem::pixmap() const
9470{
9471 Q_D(const QGraphicsPixmapItem);
9472 return d->pixmap;
9473}
9474
9475/*!
9476 Returns the transformation mode of the pixmap. The default mode is
9477 Qt::FastTransformation, which provides quick transformation with no
9478 smoothing.
9479
9480 \sa setTransformationMode()
9481*/
9482Qt::TransformationMode QGraphicsPixmapItem::transformationMode() const
9483{
9484 Q_D(const QGraphicsPixmapItem);
9485 return d->transformationMode;
9486}
9487
9488/*!
9489 Sets the pixmap item's transformation mode to \a mode, and toggles an
9490 update of the item. The default mode is Qt::FastTransformation, which
9491 provides quick transformation with no smoothing.
9492
9493 Qt::SmoothTransformation enables QPainter::SmoothPixmapTransform on the
9494 painter, and the quality depends on the platform and viewport. The result
9495 is usually not as good as calling QPixmap::scale() directly.
9496
9497 \sa transformationMode()
9498*/
9499void QGraphicsPixmapItem::setTransformationMode(Qt::TransformationMode mode)
9500{
9501 Q_D(QGraphicsPixmapItem);
9502 if (mode != d->transformationMode) {
9503 d->transformationMode = mode;
9504 update();
9505 }
9506}
9507
9508/*!
9509 Returns the pixmap item's \e offset, which defines the point of the
9510 top-left corner of the pixmap, in local coordinates.
9511
9512 \sa setOffset()
9513*/
9514QPointF QGraphicsPixmapItem::offset() const
9515{
9516 Q_D(const QGraphicsPixmapItem);
9517 return d->offset;
9518}
9519
9520/*!
9521 Sets the pixmap item's offset to \a offset. QGraphicsPixmapItem will draw
9522 its pixmap using \a offset for its top-left corner.
9523
9524 \sa offset()
9525*/
9526void QGraphicsPixmapItem::setOffset(const QPointF &offset)
9527{
9528 Q_D(QGraphicsPixmapItem);
9529 if (d->offset == offset)
9530 return;
9531 prepareGeometryChange();
9532 d->offset = offset;
9533 d->hasShape = false;
9534 update();
9535}
9536
9537/*!
9538 \fn void QGraphicsPixmapItem::setOffset(qreal x, qreal y)
9539 \since 4.3
9540
9541 This convenience function is equivalent to calling setOffset(QPointF(\a x, \a y)).
9542*/
9543
9544/*!
9545 \reimp
9546*/
9547QRectF QGraphicsPixmapItem::boundingRect() const
9548{
9549 Q_D(const QGraphicsPixmapItem);
9550 if (d->pixmap.isNull())
9551 return QRectF();
9552 if (d->flags & ItemIsSelectable) {
9553 qreal pw = 1.0;
9554 return QRectF(d->offset, d->pixmap.deviceIndependentSize()).adjusted(xp1: -pw/2, yp1: -pw/2, xp2: pw/2, yp2: pw/2);
9555 } else {
9556 return QRectF(d->offset, d->pixmap.deviceIndependentSize());
9557 }
9558}
9559
9560/*!
9561 \reimp
9562*/
9563QPainterPath QGraphicsPixmapItem::shape() const
9564{
9565 Q_D(const QGraphicsPixmapItem);
9566 if (!d->hasShape) {
9567 QGraphicsPixmapItemPrivate *thatD = const_cast<QGraphicsPixmapItemPrivate *>(d);
9568 thatD->updateShape();
9569 thatD->hasShape = true;
9570 }
9571 return d_func()->shape;
9572}
9573
9574/*!
9575 \reimp
9576*/
9577bool QGraphicsPixmapItem::contains(const QPointF &point) const
9578{
9579 return QGraphicsItem::contains(point);
9580}
9581
9582/*!
9583 \reimp
9584*/
9585void QGraphicsPixmapItem::paint(QPainter *painter, const QStyleOptionGraphicsItem *option,
9586 QWidget *widget)
9587{
9588 Q_D(QGraphicsPixmapItem);
9589 Q_UNUSED(widget);
9590
9591 painter->setRenderHint(hint: QPainter::SmoothPixmapTransform,
9592 on: (d->transformationMode == Qt::SmoothTransformation));
9593
9594 painter->drawPixmap(p: d->offset, pm: d->pixmap);
9595
9596 if (option->state & QStyle::State_Selected)
9597 qt_graphicsItem_highlightSelected(item: this, painter, option);
9598}
9599
9600/*!
9601 \reimp
9602*/
9603bool QGraphicsPixmapItem::isObscuredBy(const QGraphicsItem *item) const
9604{
9605 return QGraphicsItem::isObscuredBy(item);
9606}
9607
9608/*!
9609 \reimp
9610*/
9611QPainterPath QGraphicsPixmapItem::opaqueArea() const
9612{
9613 return shape();
9614}
9615
9616/*!
9617 \reimp
9618*/
9619int QGraphicsPixmapItem::type() const
9620{
9621 return Type;
9622}
9623
9624/*!
9625 Returns the item's shape mode. The shape mode describes how
9626 QGraphicsPixmapItem calculates its shape. The default mode is MaskShape.
9627
9628 \sa setShapeMode(), ShapeMode
9629*/
9630QGraphicsPixmapItem::ShapeMode QGraphicsPixmapItem::shapeMode() const
9631{
9632 return d_func()->shapeMode;
9633}
9634
9635/*!
9636 Sets the item's shape mode to \a mode. The shape mode describes how
9637 QGraphicsPixmapItem calculates its shape. The default mode is MaskShape.
9638
9639 \sa shapeMode(), ShapeMode
9640*/
9641void QGraphicsPixmapItem::setShapeMode(ShapeMode mode)
9642{
9643 Q_D(QGraphicsPixmapItem);
9644 if (d->shapeMode == mode)
9645 return;
9646 d->shapeMode = mode;
9647 d->hasShape = false;
9648}
9649
9650/*!
9651 \internal
9652*/
9653bool QGraphicsPixmapItem::supportsExtension(Extension extension) const
9654{
9655 Q_UNUSED(extension);
9656 return false;
9657}
9658
9659/*!
9660 \internal
9661*/
9662void QGraphicsPixmapItem::setExtension(Extension extension, const QVariant &variant)
9663{
9664 Q_UNUSED(extension);
9665 Q_UNUSED(variant);
9666}
9667
9668/*!
9669 \internal
9670*/
9671QVariant QGraphicsPixmapItem::extension(const QVariant &variant) const
9672{
9673 Q_UNUSED(variant);
9674 return QVariant();
9675}
9676
9677/*!
9678 \class QGraphicsTextItem
9679 \brief The QGraphicsTextItem class provides a text item that you can add to
9680 a QGraphicsScene to display formatted text.
9681 \since 4.2
9682 \ingroup graphicsview-api
9683 \inmodule QtWidgets
9684
9685 If you only need to show plain text in an item, consider using QGraphicsSimpleTextItem
9686 instead.
9687
9688 To set the item's text, pass a QString to QGraphicsTextItem's
9689 constructor, or call setHtml()/setPlainText().
9690
9691 QGraphicsTextItem uses the text's formatted size and the associated font
9692 to provide a reasonable implementation of boundingRect(), shape(),
9693 and contains(). You can set the font by calling setFont().
9694
9695 It is possible to make the item editable by setting the Qt::TextEditorInteraction flag
9696 using setTextInteractionFlags().
9697
9698 The item's preferred text width can be set using setTextWidth() and obtained
9699 using textWidth().
9700
9701 \note In order to align HTML text in the center, the item's text width must be set.
9702 Otherwise, you can call adjustSize() after setting the item's text.
9703
9704 \image graphicsview-textitem.png
9705
9706 \note QGraphicsTextItem accepts \l{QGraphicsItem::acceptHoverEvents()}{hover events}
9707 by default. You can change this with \l{QGraphicsItem::}{setAcceptHoverEvents()}.
9708
9709 \sa QGraphicsSimpleTextItem, QGraphicsPathItem, QGraphicsRectItem,
9710 QGraphicsEllipseItem, QGraphicsPixmapItem, QGraphicsPolygonItem,
9711 QGraphicsLineItem, {Graphics View Framework}
9712*/
9713
9714class QGraphicsTextItemPrivate
9715{
9716public:
9717 QGraphicsTextItemPrivate()
9718 : control(nullptr), pageNumber(0), useDefaultImpl(false), tabChangesFocus(false), clickCausedFocus(0)
9719 { }
9720
9721 mutable QWidgetTextControl *control;
9722 QWidgetTextControl *textControl() const;
9723
9724 inline QPointF controlOffset() const
9725 { return QPointF(0., pageNumber * control->document()->pageSize().height()); }
9726 inline void sendControlEvent(QEvent *e)
9727 { if (control) control->processEvent(e, coordinateOffset: controlOffset()); }
9728
9729 void _q_updateBoundingRect(const QSizeF &);
9730 void _q_update(QRectF);
9731 void _q_ensureVisible(QRectF);
9732 bool _q_mouseOnEdge(QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *);
9733
9734 QRectF boundingRect;
9735 int pageNumber;
9736 bool useDefaultImpl;
9737 bool tabChangesFocus;
9738
9739 uint clickCausedFocus : 1;
9740
9741 QGraphicsTextItem *qq;
9742};
9743
9744
9745/*!
9746 Constructs a QGraphicsTextItem, using \a text as the default plain
9747 text. \a parent is passed to QGraphicsItem's constructor.
9748
9749 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
9750*/
9751QGraphicsTextItem::QGraphicsTextItem(const QString &text, QGraphicsItem *parent)
9752 : QGraphicsObject(*new QGraphicsItemPrivate, parent),
9753 dd(new QGraphicsTextItemPrivate)
9754{
9755 dd->qq = this;
9756 if (!text.isEmpty())
9757 setPlainText(text);
9758 setAcceptDrops(true);
9759 setAcceptHoverEvents(true);
9760 setFlags(ItemUsesExtendedStyleOption);
9761}
9762
9763/*!
9764 Constructs a QGraphicsTextItem. \a parent is passed to QGraphicsItem's
9765 constructor.
9766
9767 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
9768*/
9769QGraphicsTextItem::QGraphicsTextItem(QGraphicsItem *parent)
9770 : QGraphicsObject(*new QGraphicsItemPrivate, parent),
9771 dd(new QGraphicsTextItemPrivate)
9772{
9773 dd->qq = this;
9774 setAcceptDrops(true);
9775 setAcceptHoverEvents(true);
9776 setFlag(flag: ItemUsesExtendedStyleOption);
9777}
9778
9779/*!
9780 Destroys the QGraphicsTextItem.
9781*/
9782QGraphicsTextItem::~QGraphicsTextItem()
9783{
9784 delete dd;
9785}
9786
9787/*!
9788 Returns the item's text converted to HTML, or an empty QString if no text has been set.
9789
9790 \sa setHtml()
9791*/
9792QString QGraphicsTextItem::toHtml() const
9793{
9794#ifndef QT_NO_TEXTHTMLPARSER
9795 if (dd->control)
9796 return dd->control->toHtml();
9797#endif
9798 return QString();
9799}
9800
9801/*!
9802 Sets the item's text to \a text, assuming that text is HTML formatted. If
9803 the item has keyboard input focus, this function will also call
9804 ensureVisible() to ensure that the text is visible in all viewports.
9805
9806 \sa toHtml(), hasFocus(), QGraphicsSimpleTextItem
9807*/
9808void QGraphicsTextItem::setHtml(const QString &text)
9809{
9810 dd->textControl()->setHtml(text);
9811}
9812
9813/*!
9814 Returns the item's text converted to plain text, or an empty QString if no text has been set.
9815
9816 \sa setPlainText()
9817*/
9818QString QGraphicsTextItem::toPlainText() const
9819{
9820 if (dd->control)
9821 return dd->control->toPlainText();
9822 return QString();
9823}
9824
9825/*!
9826 Sets the item's text to \a text. If the item has keyboard input focus,
9827 this function will also call ensureVisible() to ensure that the text is
9828 visible in all viewports.
9829
9830 \sa toHtml(), hasFocus()
9831*/
9832void QGraphicsTextItem::setPlainText(const QString &text)
9833{
9834 dd->textControl()->setPlainText(text);
9835}
9836
9837/*!
9838 Returns the item's font, which is used to render the text.
9839
9840 \sa setFont()
9841*/
9842QFont QGraphicsTextItem::font() const
9843{
9844 if (!dd->control)
9845 return QFont();
9846 return dd->control->document()->defaultFont();
9847}
9848
9849/*!
9850 Sets the font used to render the text item to \a font.
9851
9852 \sa font()
9853*/
9854void QGraphicsTextItem::setFont(const QFont &font)
9855{
9856 dd->textControl()->document()->setDefaultFont(font);
9857}
9858
9859/*!
9860 Sets the color for unformatted text to \a col.
9861*/
9862void QGraphicsTextItem::setDefaultTextColor(const QColor &col)
9863{
9864 QWidgetTextControl *c = dd->textControl();
9865 QPalette pal = c->palette();
9866 QColor old = pal.color(cr: QPalette::Text);
9867 pal.setColor(acr: QPalette::Text, acolor: col);
9868 c->setPalette(pal);
9869 if (old != col)
9870 update();
9871}
9872
9873/*!
9874 Returns the default text color that is used for unformatted text.
9875*/
9876QColor QGraphicsTextItem::defaultTextColor() const
9877{
9878 return dd->textControl()->palette().color(cr: QPalette::Text);
9879}
9880
9881/*!
9882 \reimp
9883*/
9884QRectF QGraphicsTextItem::boundingRect() const
9885{
9886 return dd->boundingRect;
9887}
9888
9889/*!
9890 \reimp
9891*/
9892QPainterPath QGraphicsTextItem::shape() const
9893{
9894 if (!dd->control)
9895 return QPainterPath();
9896 QPainterPath path;
9897 path.addRect(rect: dd->boundingRect);
9898 return path;
9899}
9900
9901/*!
9902 \reimp
9903*/
9904bool QGraphicsTextItem::contains(const QPointF &point) const
9905{
9906 return dd->boundingRect.contains(p: point);
9907}
9908
9909/*!
9910 \reimp
9911*/
9912void QGraphicsTextItem::paint(QPainter *painter, const QStyleOptionGraphicsItem *option,
9913 QWidget *widget)
9914{
9915 Q_UNUSED(widget);
9916 if (dd->control) {
9917 painter->save();
9918 QRectF r = option->exposedRect;
9919 painter->translate(offset: -dd->controlOffset());
9920 r.translate(p: dd->controlOffset());
9921
9922 QTextDocument *doc = dd->control->document();
9923 QTextDocumentLayout *layout = qobject_cast<QTextDocumentLayout *>(object: doc->documentLayout());
9924
9925 // the layout might need to expand the root frame to
9926 // the viewport if NoWrap is set
9927 if (layout)
9928 layout->setViewport(dd->boundingRect);
9929
9930 dd->control->drawContents(painter, rect: r);
9931
9932 if (layout)
9933 layout->setViewport(QRect());
9934
9935 painter->restore();
9936 }
9937
9938 if (option->state & (QStyle::State_Selected | QStyle::State_HasFocus))
9939 qt_graphicsItem_highlightSelected(item: this, painter, option);
9940}
9941
9942/*!
9943 \reimp
9944*/
9945bool QGraphicsTextItem::isObscuredBy(const QGraphicsItem *item) const
9946{
9947 return QGraphicsItem::isObscuredBy(item);
9948}
9949
9950/*!
9951 \reimp
9952*/
9953QPainterPath QGraphicsTextItem::opaqueArea() const
9954{
9955 return QGraphicsItem::opaqueArea();
9956}
9957
9958/*!
9959 \reimp
9960*/
9961int QGraphicsTextItem::type() const
9962{
9963 return Type;
9964}
9965
9966/*!
9967 Sets the preferred width for the item's text. If the actual text
9968 is wider than the specified width then it will be broken into
9969 multiple lines.
9970
9971 If \a width is set to -1 then the text will not be broken into
9972 multiple lines unless it is enforced through an explicit line
9973 break or a new paragraph.
9974
9975 The default value is -1.
9976
9977 Note that QGraphicsTextItem keeps a QTextDocument internally,
9978 which is used to calculate the text width.
9979
9980 \sa textWidth(), QTextDocument::setTextWidth()
9981*/
9982void QGraphicsTextItem::setTextWidth(qreal width)
9983{
9984 dd->textControl()->setTextWidth(width);
9985}
9986
9987/*!
9988 Returns the text width.
9989
9990 The width is calculated with the QTextDocument that
9991 QGraphicsTextItem keeps internally.
9992
9993 \sa setTextWidth(), QTextDocument::textWidth()
9994*/
9995qreal QGraphicsTextItem::textWidth() const
9996{
9997 if (!dd->control)
9998 return -1;
9999 return dd->control->textWidth();
10000}
10001
10002/*!
10003 Adjusts the text item to a reasonable size.
10004*/
10005void QGraphicsTextItem::adjustSize()
10006{
10007 if (dd->control)
10008 dd->control->adjustSize();
10009}
10010
10011/*!
10012 Sets the text document \a document on the item.
10013*/
10014void QGraphicsTextItem::setDocument(QTextDocument *document)
10015{
10016 dd->textControl()->setDocument(document);
10017 dd->_q_updateBoundingRect(dd->control->size());
10018}
10019
10020/*!
10021 Returns the item's text document.
10022*/
10023QTextDocument *QGraphicsTextItem::document() const
10024{
10025 return dd->textControl()->document();
10026}
10027
10028/*!
10029 \reimp
10030*/
10031bool QGraphicsTextItem::sceneEvent(QEvent *event)
10032{
10033 QEvent::Type t = event->type();
10034 if (!dd->tabChangesFocus && (t == QEvent::KeyPress || t == QEvent::KeyRelease)) {
10035 int k = ((QKeyEvent *)event)->key();
10036 if (k == Qt::Key_Tab || k == Qt::Key_Backtab) {
10037 dd->sendControlEvent(e: event);
10038 return true;
10039 }
10040 }
10041 bool result = QGraphicsItem::sceneEvent(event);
10042
10043 // Ensure input context is updated.
10044 switch (event->type()) {
10045 case QEvent::ContextMenu:
10046 case QEvent::FocusIn:
10047 case QEvent::FocusOut:
10048 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneDragEnter:
10049 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneDragLeave:
10050 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneDragMove:
10051 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneDrop:
10052 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneHoverEnter:
10053 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneHoverLeave:
10054 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneHoverMove:
10055 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneMouseDoubleClick:
10056 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneMousePress:
10057 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneMouseMove:
10058 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneMouseRelease:
10059 case QEvent::KeyPress:
10060 case QEvent::KeyRelease:
10061 case QEvent::InputMethod:
10062 // Reset the focus widget's input context, regardless
10063 // of how this item gained or lost focus.
10064 if (event->type() == QEvent::FocusIn || event->type() == QEvent::FocusOut) {
10065 QGuiApplication::inputMethod()->reset();
10066 } else {
10067 QGuiApplication::inputMethod()->update(queries: Qt::ImQueryInput);
10068 }
10069 break;
10070 case QEvent::ShortcutOverride:
10071 dd->sendControlEvent(e: event);
10072 return true;
10073 default:
10074 break;
10075 }
10076
10077 return result;
10078}
10079
10080/*!
10081 \reimp
10082*/
10083void QGraphicsTextItem::mousePressEvent(QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *event)
10084{
10085 if ((QGraphicsItem::d_ptr->flags & (ItemIsSelectable | ItemIsMovable))
10086 && (event->buttons() & Qt::LeftButton) && dd->_q_mouseOnEdge(event)) {
10087 // User left-pressed on edge of selectable/movable item, use
10088 // base impl.
10089 dd->useDefaultImpl = true;
10090 } else if (event->buttons() == event->button()
10091 && dd->control->textInteractionFlags() == Qt::NoTextInteraction) {
10092 // User pressed first button on non-interactive item.
10093 dd->useDefaultImpl = true;
10094 }
10095 if (dd->useDefaultImpl) {
10096 QGraphicsItem::mousePressEvent(event);
10097 if (!event->isAccepted())
10098 dd->useDefaultImpl = false;
10099 return;
10100 }
10101
10102 dd->sendControlEvent(e: event);
10103}
10104
10105/*!
10106 \reimp
10107*/
10108void QGraphicsTextItem::mouseMoveEvent(QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *event)
10109{
10110 if (dd->useDefaultImpl) {
10111 QGraphicsItem::mouseMoveEvent(event);
10112 return;
10113 }
10114
10115 dd->sendControlEvent(e: event);
10116}
10117
10118/*!
10119 \reimp
10120*/
10121void QGraphicsTextItem::mouseReleaseEvent(QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *event)
10122{
10123 if (dd->useDefaultImpl) {
10124 QGraphicsItem::mouseReleaseEvent(event);
10125 if (dd->control->textInteractionFlags() == Qt::NoTextInteraction
10126 && !event->buttons()) {
10127 // User released last button on non-interactive item.
10128 dd->useDefaultImpl = false;
10129 } else if ((event->buttons() & Qt::LeftButton) == 0) {
10130 // User released the left button on an interactive item.
10131 dd->useDefaultImpl = false;
10132 }
10133 return;
10134 }
10135
10136 QWidget *widget = event->widget();
10137 if (widget && (dd->control->textInteractionFlags() & Qt::TextEditable) && boundingRect().contains(p: event->pos())) {
10138 qt_widget_private(widget)->handleSoftwareInputPanel(button: event->button(), clickCausedFocus: dd->clickCausedFocus);
10139 }
10140 dd->clickCausedFocus = 0;
10141 dd->sendControlEvent(e: event);
10142}
10143
10144/*!
10145 \reimp
10146*/
10147void QGraphicsTextItem::mouseDoubleClickEvent(QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *event)
10148{
10149 if (dd->useDefaultImpl) {
10150 QGraphicsItem::mouseDoubleClickEvent(event);
10151 return;
10152 }
10153
10154 if (!hasFocus()) {
10155 QGraphicsItem::mouseDoubleClickEvent(event);
10156 return;
10157 }
10158
10159 dd->sendControlEvent(e: event);
10160}
10161
10162/*!
10163 \reimp
10164*/
10165void QGraphicsTextItem::contextMenuEvent(QGraphicsSceneContextMenuEvent *event)
10166{
10167 dd->sendControlEvent(e: event);
10168}
10169
10170/*!
10171 \reimp
10172*/
10173void QGraphicsTextItem::keyPressEvent(QKeyEvent *event)
10174{
10175 dd->sendControlEvent(e: event);
10176}
10177
10178/*!
10179 \reimp
10180*/
10181void QGraphicsTextItem::keyReleaseEvent(QKeyEvent *event)
10182{
10183 dd->sendControlEvent(e: event);
10184}
10185
10186/*!
10187 \reimp
10188*/
10189void QGraphicsTextItem::focusInEvent(QFocusEvent *event)
10190{
10191 dd->sendControlEvent(e: event);
10192 if (event->reason() == Qt::MouseFocusReason) {
10193 dd->clickCausedFocus = 1;
10194 }
10195 update();
10196}
10197
10198/*!
10199 \reimp
10200*/
10201void QGraphicsTextItem::focusOutEvent(QFocusEvent *event)
10202{
10203 dd->sendControlEvent(e: event);
10204 update();
10205}
10206
10207/*!
10208 \reimp
10209*/
10210void QGraphicsTextItem::dragEnterEvent(QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *event)
10211{
10212 dd->sendControlEvent(e: event);
10213}
10214
10215/*!
10216 \reimp
10217*/
10218void QGraphicsTextItem::dragLeaveEvent(QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *event)
10219{
10220 dd->sendControlEvent(e: event);
10221}
10222
10223/*!
10224 \reimp
10225*/
10226void QGraphicsTextItem::dragMoveEvent(QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *event)
10227{
10228 dd->sendControlEvent(e: event);
10229}
10230
10231/*!
10232 \reimp
10233*/
10234void QGraphicsTextItem::dropEvent(QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *event)
10235{
10236 dd->sendControlEvent(e: event);
10237}
10238
10239/*!
10240 \reimp
10241*/
10242void QGraphicsTextItem::inputMethodEvent(QInputMethodEvent *event)
10243{
10244 dd->sendControlEvent(e: event);
10245}
10246
10247/*!
10248 \reimp
10249*/
10250void QGraphicsTextItem::hoverEnterEvent(QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent *event)
10251{
10252 dd->sendControlEvent(e: event);
10253}
10254
10255/*!
10256 \reimp
10257*/
10258void QGraphicsTextItem::hoverMoveEvent(QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent *event)
10259{
10260 dd->sendControlEvent(e: event);
10261}
10262
10263/*!
10264 \reimp
10265*/
10266void QGraphicsTextItem::hoverLeaveEvent(QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent *event)
10267{
10268 dd->sendControlEvent(e: event);
10269}
10270
10271/*!
10272 \reimp
10273*/
10274QVariant QGraphicsTextItem::inputMethodQuery(Qt::InputMethodQuery query) const
10275{
10276 QVariant v;
10277 if (query == Qt::ImEnabled)
10278 return isEnabled();
10279 else if (query == Qt::ImHints)
10280 v = int(inputMethodHints());
10281 else if (dd->control)
10282 v = dd->control->inputMethodQuery(property: query, argument: QVariant());
10283 if (dd->control) {
10284 if (v.userType() == QMetaType::QRectF)
10285 v = v.toRectF().translated(p: -dd->controlOffset());
10286 else if (v.userType() == QMetaType::QPointF)
10287 v = v.toPointF() - dd->controlOffset();
10288 else if (v.userType() == QMetaType::QRect)
10289 v = v.toRect().translated(p: -dd->controlOffset().toPoint());
10290 else if (v.userType() == QMetaType::QPoint)
10291 v = v.toPoint() - dd->controlOffset().toPoint();
10292 }
10293 return v;
10294}
10295
10296/*!
10297 \internal
10298*/
10299bool QGraphicsTextItem::supportsExtension(Extension extension) const
10300{
10301 Q_UNUSED(extension);
10302 return false;
10303}
10304
10305/*!
10306 \internal
10307*/
10308void QGraphicsTextItem::setExtension(Extension extension, const QVariant &variant)
10309{
10310 Q_UNUSED(extension);
10311 Q_UNUSED(variant);
10312}
10313
10314/*!
10315 \internal
10316*/
10317QVariant QGraphicsTextItem::extension(const QVariant &variant) const
10318{
10319 Q_UNUSED(variant);
10320 return QVariant();
10321}
10322
10323/*!
10324 \internal
10325*/
10326void QGraphicsTextItemPrivate::_q_update(QRectF rect)
10327{
10328 if (rect.isValid()) {
10329 rect.translate(p: -controlOffset());
10330 } else {
10331 rect = boundingRect;
10332 }
10333 if (rect.intersects(r: boundingRect))
10334 qq->update(rect);
10335}
10336
10337/*!
10338 \internal
10339*/
10340void QGraphicsTextItemPrivate::_q_updateBoundingRect(const QSizeF &size)
10341{
10342 if (size != boundingRect.size()) {
10343 qq->prepareGeometryChange();
10344 boundingRect.setSize(size);
10345 qq->update();
10346 }
10347}
10348
10349/*!
10350 \internal
10351*/
10352void QGraphicsTextItemPrivate::_q_ensureVisible(QRectF rect)
10353{
10354 if (qq->hasFocus()) {
10355 rect.translate(p: -controlOffset());
10356 qq->ensureVisible(rect, /*xmargin=*/0, /*ymargin=*/0);
10357 }
10358}
10359
10360QWidgetTextControl *QGraphicsTextItemPrivate::textControl() const
10361{
10362 if (!control) {
10363 QGraphicsTextItem *that = const_cast<QGraphicsTextItem *>(qq);
10364 control = new QWidgetTextControl(that);
10365 control->setTextInteractionFlags(Qt::NoTextInteraction);
10366
10367 QObject::connect(sender: control, signal: &QWidgetTextControl::updateRequest, context: qq,
10368 slot: [dd = that->dd](const QRectF &rect) { dd->_q_update(rect); });
10369 QObject::connect(sender: control, signal: &QWidgetTextControl::documentSizeChanged, context: qq,
10370 slot: [dd = that->dd](QSizeF size) { dd->_q_updateBoundingRect(size); });
10371 QObject::connect(sender: control, signal: &QWidgetTextControl::visibilityRequest, context: qq,
10372 slot: [dd = that->dd](const QRectF &rect) { dd->_q_ensureVisible(rect); });
10373 QObject::connect(sender: control, signal: &QWidgetTextControl::linkActivated, receiver: qq,
10374 slot: &QGraphicsTextItem::linkActivated);
10375 QObject::connect(sender: control, signal: &QWidgetTextControl::linkHovered, receiver: qq,
10376 slot: &QGraphicsTextItem::linkHovered);
10377
10378 const QSizeF pgSize = control->document()->pageSize();
10379 if (pgSize.height() != -1) {
10380 qq->prepareGeometryChange();
10381 that->dd->boundingRect.setSize(pgSize);
10382 qq->update();
10383 } else {
10384 that->dd->_q_updateBoundingRect(size: control->size());
10385 }
10386 }
10387 return control;
10388}
10389
10390/*!
10391 \internal
10392*/
10393bool QGraphicsTextItemPrivate::_q_mouseOnEdge(QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *event)
10394{
10395 QPainterPath path;
10396 path.addRect(rect: qq->boundingRect());
10397
10398 QPainterPath docPath;
10399 const QTextFrameFormat format = control->document()->rootFrame()->frameFormat();
10400 docPath.addRect(
10401 rect: qq->boundingRect().adjusted(
10402 xp1: format.leftMargin(),
10403 yp1: format.topMargin(),
10404 xp2: -format.rightMargin(),
10405 yp2: -format.bottomMargin()));
10406
10407 return path.subtracted(r: docPath).contains(pt: event->pos());
10408}
10409
10410/*!
10411 \fn void QGraphicsTextItem::linkActivated(const QString &link)
10412
10413 This signal is emitted when the user clicks on a link on a text item
10414 that enables Qt::LinksAccessibleByMouse or Qt::LinksAccessibleByKeyboard.
10415 \a link is the link that was clicked.
10416
10417 \sa setTextInteractionFlags()
10418*/
10419
10420/*!
10421 \fn void QGraphicsTextItem::linkHovered(const QString &link)
10422
10423 This signal is emitted when the user hovers over a link on a text item
10424 that enables Qt::LinksAccessibleByMouse. \a link is
10425 the link that was hovered over.
10426
10427 \sa setTextInteractionFlags()
10428*/
10429
10430/*!
10431 Sets the flags \a flags to specify how the text item should react to user
10432 input.
10433
10434 The default for a QGraphicsTextItem is Qt::NoTextInteraction. This function
10435 also affects the ItemIsFocusable QGraphicsItem flag by setting it if \a flags
10436 is different from Qt::NoTextInteraction and clearing it otherwise.
10437
10438 By default, the text is read-only. To transform the item into an editor,
10439 set the Qt::TextEditable flag.
10440*/
10441void QGraphicsTextItem::setTextInteractionFlags(Qt::TextInteractionFlags flags)
10442{
10443 if (flags == Qt::NoTextInteraction)
10444 setFlags(this->flags() & ~(QGraphicsItem::ItemIsFocusable | QGraphicsItem::ItemAcceptsInputMethod));
10445 else
10446 setFlags(this->flags() | QGraphicsItem::ItemIsFocusable | QGraphicsItem::ItemAcceptsInputMethod);
10447
10448 dd->textControl()->setTextInteractionFlags(flags);
10449}
10450
10451/*!
10452 Returns the current text interaction flags.
10453
10454 \sa setTextInteractionFlags()
10455*/
10456Qt::TextInteractionFlags QGraphicsTextItem::textInteractionFlags() const
10457{
10458 if (!dd->control)
10459 return Qt::NoTextInteraction;
10460 return dd->control->textInteractionFlags();
10461}
10462
10463/*!
10464 \since 4.5
10465
10466 If \a b is true, the \uicontrol Tab key will cause the widget to change focus;
10467 otherwise, the tab key will insert a tab into the document.
10468
10469 In some occasions text edits should not allow the user to input tabulators
10470 or change indentation using the \uicontrol Tab key, as this breaks the focus
10471 chain. The default is false.
10472
10473 \sa tabChangesFocus(), ItemIsFocusable, textInteractionFlags()
10474*/
10475void QGraphicsTextItem::setTabChangesFocus(bool b)
10476{
10477 dd->tabChangesFocus = b;
10478}
10479
10480/*!
10481 \since 4.5
10482
10483 Returns \c true if the \uicontrol Tab key will cause the widget to change focus;
10484 otherwise, false is returned.
10485
10486 By default, this behavior is disabled, and this function will return false.
10487
10488 \sa setTabChangesFocus()
10489*/
10490bool QGraphicsTextItem::tabChangesFocus() const
10491{
10492 return dd->tabChangesFocus;
10493}
10494
10495/*!
10496 \property QGraphicsTextItem::openExternalLinks
10497
10498 Specifies whether QGraphicsTextItem should automatically open links using
10499 QDesktopServices::openUrl() instead of emitting the
10500 linkActivated signal.
10501
10502 The default value is false.
10503*/
10504void QGraphicsTextItem::setOpenExternalLinks(bool open)
10505{
10506 dd->textControl()->setOpenExternalLinks(open);
10507}
10508
10509bool QGraphicsTextItem::openExternalLinks() const
10510{
10511 if (!dd->control)
10512 return false;
10513 return dd->control->openExternalLinks();
10514}
10515
10516/*!
10517 \property QGraphicsTextItem::textCursor
10518
10519 This property represents the visible text cursor in an editable
10520 text item.
10521
10522 By default, if the item's text has not been set, this property
10523 contains a null text cursor; otherwise it contains a text cursor
10524 placed at the start of the item's document.
10525*/
10526void QGraphicsTextItem::setTextCursor(const QTextCursor &cursor)
10527{
10528 dd->textControl()->setTextCursor(cursor);
10529}
10530
10531QTextCursor QGraphicsTextItem::textCursor() const
10532{
10533 if (!dd->control)
10534 return QTextCursor();
10535 return dd->control->textCursor();
10536}
10537
10538class QGraphicsSimpleTextItemPrivate : public QAbstractGraphicsShapeItemPrivate
10539{
10540 Q_DECLARE_PUBLIC(QGraphicsSimpleTextItem)
10541public:
10542 inline QGraphicsSimpleTextItemPrivate() {
10543 pen.setStyle(Qt::NoPen);
10544 brush.setStyle(Qt::SolidPattern);
10545 }
10546 QString text;
10547 QFont font;
10548 QRectF boundingRect;
10549
10550 void updateBoundingRect();
10551};
10552
10553static QRectF setupTextLayout(QTextLayout *layout)
10554{
10555 layout->setCacheEnabled(true);
10556 layout->beginLayout();
10557 while (layout->createLine().isValid())
10558 ;
10559 layout->endLayout();
10560 qreal maxWidth = 0;
10561 qreal y = 0;
10562 for (int i = 0; i < layout->lineCount(); ++i) {
10563 QTextLine line = layout->lineAt(i);
10564 maxWidth = qMax(a: maxWidth, b: line.naturalTextWidth());
10565 line.setPosition(QPointF(0, y));
10566 y += line.height();
10567 }
10568 return QRectF(0, 0, maxWidth, y);
10569}
10570
10571void QGraphicsSimpleTextItemPrivate::updateBoundingRect()
10572{
10573 Q_Q(QGraphicsSimpleTextItem);
10574 QRectF br;
10575 if (text.isEmpty()) {
10576 br = QRectF();
10577 } else {
10578 QString tmp = text;
10579 tmp.replace(before: u'\n', after: QChar::LineSeparator);
10580 QStackTextEngine engine(tmp, font);
10581 QTextLayout layout(&engine);
10582 br = setupTextLayout(&layout);
10583 }
10584 if (br != boundingRect) {
10585 q->prepareGeometryChange();
10586 boundingRect = br;
10587 q->update();
10588 }
10589}
10590
10591/*!
10592 \class QGraphicsSimpleTextItem
10593 \brief The QGraphicsSimpleTextItem class provides a simple text path item
10594 that you can add to a QGraphicsScene.
10595 \since 4.2
10596 \ingroup graphicsview-api
10597 \inmodule QtWidgets
10598
10599 To set the item's text, you can either pass a QString to
10600 QGraphicsSimpleTextItem's constructor, or call setText() to change the
10601 text later. To set the text fill color, call setBrush().
10602
10603 The simple text item can have both a fill and an outline; setBrush() will
10604 set the text fill (i.e., text color), and setPen() sets the pen that will
10605 be used to draw the text outline. (The latter can be slow, especially for
10606 complex pens, and items with long text content.) If all you want is to
10607 draw a simple line of text, you should call setBrush() only, and leave the
10608 pen unset; QGraphicsSimpleTextItem's pen is by default Qt::NoPen.
10609
10610 QGraphicsSimpleTextItem uses the text's formatted size and the associated
10611 font to provide a reasonable implementation of boundingRect(), shape(),
10612 and contains(). You can set the font by calling setFont().
10613
10614 QGraphicsSimpleText does not display rich text; instead, you can use
10615 QGraphicsTextItem, which provides full text control capabilities.
10616
10617 \image graphicsview-simpletextitem.png
10618
10619 \sa QGraphicsTextItem, QGraphicsPathItem, QGraphicsRectItem,
10620 QGraphicsEllipseItem, QGraphicsPixmapItem, QGraphicsPolygonItem,
10621 QGraphicsLineItem, {Graphics View Framework}
10622*/
10623
10624/*!
10625 Constructs a QGraphicsSimpleTextItem.
10626
10627 \a parent is passed to QGraphicsItem's constructor.
10628
10629 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
10630*/
10631QGraphicsSimpleTextItem::QGraphicsSimpleTextItem(QGraphicsItem *parent)
10632 : QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem(*new QGraphicsSimpleTextItemPrivate, parent)
10633{
10634}
10635
10636/*!
10637 Constructs a QGraphicsSimpleTextItem, using \a text as the default plain text.
10638
10639 \a parent is passed to QGraphicsItem's constructor.
10640
10641 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
10642*/
10643QGraphicsSimpleTextItem::QGraphicsSimpleTextItem(const QString &text, QGraphicsItem *parent)
10644 : QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem(*new QGraphicsSimpleTextItemPrivate, parent)
10645{
10646 setText(text);
10647}
10648
10649/*!
10650 Destroys the QGraphicsSimpleTextItem.
10651*/
10652QGraphicsSimpleTextItem::~QGraphicsSimpleTextItem()
10653{
10654}
10655
10656/*!
10657 Sets the item's text to \a text. The text will be displayed as
10658 plain text. Newline characters ('\\n') as well as characters of
10659 type QChar::LineSeparator will cause item to break the text into
10660 multiple lines.
10661*/
10662void QGraphicsSimpleTextItem::setText(const QString &text)
10663{
10664 Q_D(QGraphicsSimpleTextItem);
10665 if (d->text == text)
10666 return;
10667 d->text = text;
10668 d->updateBoundingRect();
10669 update();
10670}
10671
10672/*!
10673 Returns the item's text.
10674*/
10675QString QGraphicsSimpleTextItem::text() const
10676{
10677 Q_D(const QGraphicsSimpleTextItem);
10678 return d->text;
10679}
10680
10681/*!
10682 Sets the font that is used to draw the item's text to \a font.
10683*/
10684void QGraphicsSimpleTextItem::setFont(const QFont &font)
10685{
10686 Q_D(QGraphicsSimpleTextItem);
10687 d->font = font;
10688 d->updateBoundingRect();
10689}
10690
10691/*!
10692 Returns the font that is used to draw the item's text.
10693*/
10694QFont QGraphicsSimpleTextItem::font() const
10695{
10696 Q_D(const QGraphicsSimpleTextItem);
10697 return d->font;
10698}
10699
10700/*!
10701 \reimp
10702*/
10703QRectF QGraphicsSimpleTextItem::boundingRect() const
10704{
10705 Q_D(const QGraphicsSimpleTextItem);
10706 return d->boundingRect;
10707}
10708
10709/*!
10710 \reimp
10711*/
10712QPainterPath QGraphicsSimpleTextItem::shape() const
10713{
10714 Q_D(const QGraphicsSimpleTextItem);
10715 QPainterPath path;
10716 path.addRect(rect: d->boundingRect);
10717 return path;
10718}
10719
10720/*!
10721 \reimp
10722*/
10723bool QGraphicsSimpleTextItem::contains(const QPointF &point) const
10724{
10725 Q_D(const QGraphicsSimpleTextItem);
10726 return d->boundingRect.contains(p: point);
10727}
10728
10729/*!
10730 \reimp
10731*/
10732void QGraphicsSimpleTextItem::paint(QPainter *painter, const QStyleOptionGraphicsItem *option, QWidget *widget)
10733{
10734 Q_UNUSED(widget);
10735 Q_D(QGraphicsSimpleTextItem);
10736
10737 painter->setFont(d->font);
10738
10739 QString tmp = d->text;
10740 tmp.replace(before: u'\n', after: QChar::LineSeparator);
10741 QStackTextEngine engine(tmp, d->font);
10742 QTextLayout layout(&engine);
10743
10744 QPen p;
10745 p.setBrush(d->brush);
10746 painter->setPen(p);
10747 if (d->pen.style() == Qt::NoPen && d->brush.style() == Qt::SolidPattern) {
10748 painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
10749 } else {
10750 QTextLayout::FormatRange range;
10751 range.start = 0;
10752 range.length = layout.text().size();
10753 range.format.setTextOutline(d->pen);
10754 layout.setFormats(QList<QTextLayout::FormatRange>(1, range));
10755 }
10756
10757 setupTextLayout(&layout);
10758 layout.draw(p: painter, pos: QPointF(0, 0));
10759
10760 if (option->state & (QStyle::State_Selected | QStyle::State_HasFocus))
10761 qt_graphicsItem_highlightSelected(item: this, painter, option);
10762}
10763
10764/*!
10765 \reimp
10766*/
10767bool QGraphicsSimpleTextItem::isObscuredBy(const QGraphicsItem *item) const
10768{
10769 return QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::isObscuredBy(item);
10770}
10771
10772/*!
10773 \reimp
10774*/
10775QPainterPath QGraphicsSimpleTextItem::opaqueArea() const
10776{
10777 return QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem::opaqueArea();
10778}
10779
10780/*!
10781 \reimp
10782*/
10783int QGraphicsSimpleTextItem::type() const
10784{
10785 return Type;
10786}
10787
10788/*!
10789 \internal
10790*/
10791bool QGraphicsSimpleTextItem::supportsExtension(Extension extension) const
10792{
10793 Q_UNUSED(extension);
10794 return false;
10795}
10796
10797/*!
10798 \internal
10799*/
10800void QGraphicsSimpleTextItem::setExtension(Extension extension, const QVariant &variant)
10801{
10802 Q_UNUSED(extension);
10803 Q_UNUSED(variant);
10804}
10805
10806/*!
10807 \internal
10808*/
10809QVariant QGraphicsSimpleTextItem::extension(const QVariant &variant) const
10810{
10811 Q_UNUSED(variant);
10812 return QVariant();
10813}
10814
10815/*!
10816 \class QGraphicsItemGroup
10817 \brief The QGraphicsItemGroup class provides a container that treats
10818 a group of items as a single item.
10819 \since 4.2
10820 \ingroup graphicsview-api
10821 \inmodule QtWidgets
10822
10823 A QGraphicsItemGroup is a special type of compound item that
10824 treats itself and all its children as one item (i.e., all events
10825 and geometries for all children are merged together). It's common
10826 to use item groups in presentation tools, when the user wants to
10827 group several smaller items into one big item in order to simplify
10828 moving and copying of items.
10829
10830 If all you want is to store items inside other items, you can use
10831 any QGraphicsItem directly by passing a suitable parent to
10832 setParentItem().
10833
10834 The boundingRect() function of QGraphicsItemGroup returns the
10835 bounding rectangle of all items in the item group.
10836 QGraphicsItemGroup ignores the ItemIgnoresTransformations flag on
10837 its children (i.e., with respect to the geometry of the group
10838 item, the children are treated as if they were transformable).
10839
10840 There are two ways to construct an item group. The easiest and
10841 most common approach is to pass a list of items (e.g., all
10842 selected items) to QGraphicsScene::createItemGroup(), which
10843 returns a new QGraphicsItemGroup item. The other approach is to
10844 manually construct a QGraphicsItemGroup item, add it to the scene
10845 calling QGraphicsScene::addItem(), and then add items to the group
10846 manually, one at a time by calling addToGroup(). To dismantle
10847 ("ungroup") an item group, you can either call
10848 QGraphicsScene::destroyItemGroup(), or you can manually remove all
10849 items from the group by calling removeFromGroup().
10850
10851 \snippet code/src_gui_graphicsview_qgraphicsitem.cpp 17
10852
10853 The operation of adding and removing items preserves the items'
10854 scene-relative position and transformation, as opposed to calling
10855 setParentItem(), where only the child item's parent-relative
10856 position and transformation are kept.
10857
10858 The addtoGroup() function reparents the target item to this item
10859 group, keeping the item's position and transformation intact
10860 relative to the scene. Visually, this means that items added via
10861 addToGroup() will remain completely unchanged as a result of this
10862 operation, regardless of the item or the group's current position
10863 or transformation; although the item's position and matrix are
10864 likely to change.
10865
10866 The removeFromGroup() function has similar semantics to
10867 setParentItem(); it reparents the item to the parent item of the
10868 item group. As with addToGroup(), the item's scene-relative
10869 position and transformation remain intact.
10870
10871 \sa QGraphicsItem, {Graphics View Framework}
10872*/
10873
10874class QGraphicsItemGroupPrivate : public QGraphicsItemPrivate
10875{
10876public:
10877 QRectF itemsBoundingRect;
10878};
10879
10880/*!
10881 Constructs a QGraphicsItemGroup. \a parent is passed to QGraphicsItem's
10882 constructor.
10883
10884 \sa QGraphicsScene::addItem()
10885*/
10886QGraphicsItemGroup::QGraphicsItemGroup(QGraphicsItem *parent)
10887 : QGraphicsItem(*new QGraphicsItemGroupPrivate, parent)
10888{
10889 setHandlesChildEvents(true);
10890}
10891
10892/*!
10893 Destroys the QGraphicsItemGroup.
10894*/
10895QGraphicsItemGroup::~QGraphicsItemGroup()
10896{
10897}
10898
10899/*!
10900 Adds the given \a item and item's child items to this item group.
10901 The item and child items will be reparented to this group, but its
10902 position and transformation relative to the scene will stay intact.
10903
10904 \sa removeFromGroup(), QGraphicsScene::createItemGroup()
10905*/
10906void QGraphicsItemGroup::addToGroup(QGraphicsItem *item)
10907{
10908 Q_D(QGraphicsItemGroup);
10909 if (!item) {
10910 qWarning(msg: "QGraphicsItemGroup::addToGroup: cannot add null item");
10911 return;
10912 }
10913 if (item == this) {
10914 qWarning(msg: "QGraphicsItemGroup::addToGroup: cannot add a group to itself");
10915 return;
10916 }
10917
10918 // COMBINE
10919 bool ok;
10920 QTransform itemTransform = item->itemTransform(other: this, ok: &ok);
10921
10922 if (!ok) {
10923 qWarning(msg: "QGraphicsItemGroup::addToGroup: could not find a valid transformation from item to group coordinates");
10924 return;
10925 }
10926
10927 QTransform newItemTransform(itemTransform);
10928 item->setPos(mapFromItem(item, ax: 0, ay: 0));
10929 item->setParentItem(this);
10930
10931 // removing position from translation component of the new transform
10932 if (!item->pos().isNull())
10933 newItemTransform *= QTransform::fromTranslate(dx: -item->x(), dy: -item->y());
10934
10935 // removing additional transformations properties applied with itemTransform()
10936 QPointF origin = item->transformOriginPoint();
10937 QMatrix4x4 m;
10938 QList<QGraphicsTransform*> transformList = item->transformations();
10939 for (int i = 0; i < transformList.size(); ++i)
10940 transformList.at(i)->applyTo(matrix: &m);
10941 newItemTransform *= m.toTransform().inverted();
10942 newItemTransform.translate(dx: origin.x(), dy: origin.y());
10943 newItemTransform.rotate(a: -item->rotation());
10944 newItemTransform.scale(sx: 1/item->scale(), sy: 1/item->scale());
10945 newItemTransform.translate(dx: -origin.x(), dy: -origin.y());
10946
10947 // ### Expensive, we could maybe use dirtySceneTransform bit for optimization
10948
10949 item->setTransform(matrix: newItemTransform);
10950 item->d_func()->setIsMemberOfGroup(true);
10951 prepareGeometryChange();
10952 d->itemsBoundingRect |= itemTransform.mapRect(item->boundingRect() | item->childrenBoundingRect());
10953 update();
10954}
10955
10956/*!
10957 Removes the specified \a item from this group. The item will be
10958 reparented to this group's parent item, or to 0 if this group has
10959 no parent. Its position and transformation relative to the scene
10960 will stay intact.
10961
10962 \sa addToGroup(), QGraphicsScene::destroyItemGroup()
10963*/
10964void QGraphicsItemGroup::removeFromGroup(QGraphicsItem *item)
10965{
10966 Q_D(QGraphicsItemGroup);
10967 if (!item) {
10968 qWarning(msg: "QGraphicsItemGroup::removeFromGroup: cannot remove null item");
10969 return;
10970 }
10971
10972 QGraphicsItem *newParent = d_ptr->parent;
10973
10974 // COMBINE
10975 bool ok;
10976 QTransform itemTransform;
10977 if (newParent)
10978 itemTransform = item->itemTransform(other: newParent, ok: &ok);
10979 else
10980 itemTransform = item->sceneTransform();
10981
10982 QPointF oldPos = item->mapToItem(item: newParent, ax: 0, ay: 0);
10983 item->setParentItem(newParent);
10984 item->setPos(oldPos);
10985
10986 // removing position from translation component of the new transform
10987 if (!item->pos().isNull())
10988 itemTransform *= QTransform::fromTranslate(dx: -item->x(), dy: -item->y());
10989
10990 // removing additional transformations properties applied
10991 // with itemTransform() or sceneTransform()
10992 QPointF origin = item->transformOriginPoint();
10993 QMatrix4x4 m;
10994 QList<QGraphicsTransform*> transformList = item->transformations();
10995 for (int i = 0; i < transformList.size(); ++i)
10996 transformList.at(i)->applyTo(matrix: &m);
10997 itemTransform *= m.toTransform().inverted();
10998 itemTransform.translate(dx: origin.x(), dy: origin.y());
10999 itemTransform.rotate(a: -item->rotation());
11000 itemTransform.scale(sx: 1 / item->scale(), sy: 1 / item->scale());
11001 itemTransform.translate(dx: -origin.x(), dy: -origin.y());
11002
11003 // ### Expensive, we could maybe use dirtySceneTransform bit for optimization
11004
11005 item->setTransform(matrix: itemTransform);
11006 item->d_func()->setIsMemberOfGroup(item->group() != nullptr);
11007
11008 // ### Quite expensive. But removeFromGroup() isn't called very often.
11009 prepareGeometryChange();
11010 d->itemsBoundingRect = childrenBoundingRect();
11011}
11012
11013/*!
11014 \reimp
11015
11016 Returns the bounding rect of this group item, and all its children.
11017*/
11018QRectF QGraphicsItemGroup::boundingRect() const
11019{
11020 Q_D(const QGraphicsItemGroup);
11021 return d->itemsBoundingRect;
11022}
11023
11024/*!
11025 \reimp
11026*/
11027void QGraphicsItemGroup::paint(QPainter *painter, const QStyleOptionGraphicsItem *option,
11028 QWidget *widget)
11029{
11030 Q_UNUSED(widget);
11031 if (option->state & QStyle::State_Selected) {
11032 Q_D(QGraphicsItemGroup);
11033 painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
11034 painter->drawRect(rect: d->itemsBoundingRect);
11035 }
11036}
11037
11038/*!
11039 \reimp
11040*/
11041bool QGraphicsItemGroup::isObscuredBy(const QGraphicsItem *item) const
11042{
11043 return QGraphicsItem::isObscuredBy(item);
11044}
11045
11046/*!
11047 \reimp
11048*/
11049QPainterPath QGraphicsItemGroup::opaqueArea() const
11050{
11051 return QGraphicsItem::opaqueArea();
11052}
11053
11054/*!
11055 \reimp
11056*/
11057int QGraphicsItemGroup::type() const
11058{
11059 return Type;
11060}
11061
11062#if QT_CONFIG(graphicseffect)
11063QRectF QGraphicsItemEffectSourcePrivate::boundingRect(Qt::CoordinateSystem system) const
11064{
11065 const bool deviceCoordinates = (system == Qt::DeviceCoordinates);
11066 if (!info && deviceCoordinates) {
11067 // Device coordinates without info not yet supported.
11068 qWarning(msg: "QGraphicsEffectSource::boundingRect: Not yet implemented, lacking device context");
11069 return QRectF();
11070 }
11071
11072 QRectF rect = item->boundingRect();
11073 if (!item->d_ptr->children.isEmpty())
11074 rect |= item->childrenBoundingRect();
11075
11076 if (deviceCoordinates) {
11077 Q_ASSERT(info->painter);
11078 rect = info->painter->worldTransform().mapRect(rect);
11079 }
11080
11081 return rect;
11082}
11083
11084void QGraphicsItemEffectSourcePrivate::draw(QPainter *painter)
11085{
11086 if (!info) {
11087 qWarning(msg: "QGraphicsEffectSource::draw: Can only begin as a result of QGraphicsEffect::draw");
11088 return;
11089 }
11090
11091 Q_ASSERT(item->d_ptr->scene);
11092 QGraphicsScenePrivate *scened = item->d_ptr->scene->d_func();
11093 if (painter == info->painter) {
11094 scened->draw(item, painter, info->viewTransform, info->transformPtr, info->exposedRegion,
11095 info->widget, info->opacity, info->effectTransform, info->wasDirtySceneTransform,
11096 info->drawItem);
11097 } else {
11098 QTransform effectTransform = info->painter->worldTransform().inverted();
11099 effectTransform *= painter->worldTransform();
11100 scened->draw(item, painter, info->viewTransform, info->transformPtr, info->exposedRegion,
11101 info->widget, info->opacity, &effectTransform, info->wasDirtySceneTransform,
11102 info->drawItem);
11103 }
11104}
11105
11106// sourceRect must be in the given coordinate system
11107QRectF QGraphicsItemEffectSourcePrivate::paddedEffectRect(Qt::CoordinateSystem system, QGraphicsEffect::PixmapPadMode mode, const QRectF &sourceRect, bool *unpadded) const
11108{
11109 QRectF effectRectF;
11110
11111 if (unpadded)
11112 *unpadded = false;
11113
11114 if (mode == QGraphicsEffect::PadToEffectiveBoundingRect) {
11115 if (info) {
11116 QRectF deviceRect = system == Qt::DeviceCoordinates ? sourceRect : info->painter->worldTransform().mapRect(sourceRect);
11117 effectRectF = item->graphicsEffect()->boundingRectFor(sourceRect: deviceRect);
11118 if (unpadded)
11119 *unpadded = (effectRectF.size() == sourceRect.size());
11120 if (info && system == Qt::LogicalCoordinates)
11121 effectRectF = info->painter->worldTransform().inverted().mapRect(effectRectF);
11122 } else {
11123 // no choice but to send a logical coordinate bounding rect to boundingRectFor
11124 effectRectF = item->graphicsEffect()->boundingRectFor(sourceRect);
11125 }
11126 } else if (mode == QGraphicsEffect::PadToTransparentBorder) {
11127 // adjust by 1.5 to account for cosmetic pens
11128 effectRectF = sourceRect.adjusted(xp1: -1.5, yp1: -1.5, xp2: 1.5, yp2: 1.5);
11129 } else {
11130 effectRectF = sourceRect;
11131 if (unpadded)
11132 *unpadded = true;
11133 }
11134
11135 return effectRectF;
11136}
11137
11138QPixmap QGraphicsItemEffectSourcePrivate::pixmap(Qt::CoordinateSystem system, QPoint *offset,
11139 QGraphicsEffect::PixmapPadMode mode) const
11140{
11141 const bool deviceCoordinates = (system == Qt::DeviceCoordinates);
11142 if (!info && deviceCoordinates) {
11143 // Device coordinates without info not yet supported.
11144 qWarning(msg: "QGraphicsEffectSource::pixmap: Not yet implemented, lacking device context");
11145 return QPixmap();
11146 }
11147 if (!item->d_ptr->scene)
11148 return QPixmap();
11149 QGraphicsScenePrivate *scened = item->d_ptr->scene->d_func();
11150
11151 bool unpadded;
11152 const QRectF sourceRect = boundingRect(system);
11153 QRectF effectRectF = paddedEffectRect(system, mode, sourceRect, unpadded: &unpadded);
11154 QRect effectRect = effectRectF.toAlignedRect();
11155
11156 if (offset)
11157 *offset = effectRect.topLeft();
11158
11159 bool untransformed = !deviceCoordinates
11160 || info->painter->worldTransform().type() <= QTransform::TxTranslate;
11161 if (untransformed && unpadded && isPixmap()) {
11162 if (offset)
11163 *offset = boundingRect(system).topLeft().toPoint();
11164 return static_cast<QGraphicsPixmapItem *>(item)->pixmap();
11165 }
11166
11167 if (effectRect.isEmpty())
11168 return QPixmap();
11169
11170 const auto dpr = info ? info->painter->device()->devicePixelRatio() : 1.0;
11171 QPixmap pixmap(QRectF(effectRectF.topLeft(), effectRectF.size() * dpr).toAlignedRect().size());
11172 pixmap.setDevicePixelRatio(dpr);
11173 pixmap.fill(fillColor: Qt::transparent);
11174 QPainter pixmapPainter(&pixmap);
11175 pixmapPainter.setRenderHints(hints: info ? info->painter->renderHints() : QPainter::TextAntialiasing);
11176
11177 QTransform effectTransform = QTransform::fromTranslate(dx: -effectRect.x(), dy: -effectRect.y());
11178 if (deviceCoordinates && info->effectTransform)
11179 effectTransform *= *info->effectTransform;
11180
11181 if (!info) {
11182 // Logical coordinates without info.
11183 QTransform sceneTransform = item->sceneTransform();
11184 QTransform newEffectTransform = sceneTransform.inverted();
11185 newEffectTransform *= effectTransform;
11186 scened->draw(item, &pixmapPainter, nullptr, &sceneTransform, nullptr, nullptr, qreal(1.0),
11187 &newEffectTransform, false, true);
11188 } else if (deviceCoordinates) {
11189 // Device coordinates with info.
11190 scened->draw(item, &pixmapPainter, info->viewTransform, info->transformPtr, nullptr,
11191 info->widget, info->opacity, &effectTransform, info->wasDirtySceneTransform,
11192 info->drawItem);
11193 } else {
11194 // Item coordinates with info.
11195 QTransform newEffectTransform = info->transformPtr->inverted();
11196 newEffectTransform *= effectTransform;
11197 scened->draw(item, &pixmapPainter, info->viewTransform, info->transformPtr, nullptr,
11198 info->widget, info->opacity, &newEffectTransform, info->wasDirtySceneTransform,
11199 info->drawItem);
11200 }
11201
11202 pixmapPainter.end();
11203
11204 return pixmap;
11205}
11206#endif // QT_CONFIG(graphicseffect)
11207
11208#ifndef QT_NO_DEBUG_STREAM
11209static void formatGraphicsItemHelper(QDebug debug, const QGraphicsItem *item)
11210{
11211 if (const QGraphicsItem *parent = item->parentItem())
11212 debug << ", parent=" << static_cast<const void *>(parent);
11213 debug << ", pos=";
11214 QtDebugUtils::formatQPoint(debug, point: item->pos());
11215 if (const qreal z = item->zValue())
11216 debug << ", z=" << z;
11217 if (item->flags())
11218 debug << ", flags=" << item->flags();
11219}
11220
11221QDebug operator<<(QDebug debug, const QGraphicsItem *item)
11222{
11223 QDebugStateSaver saver(debug);
11224 debug.nospace();
11225
11226 if (!item) {
11227 debug << "QGraphicsItem(0)";
11228 return debug;
11229 }
11230
11231 if (const QGraphicsObject *o = item->toGraphicsObject())
11232 debug << o->metaObject()->className();
11233 else
11234 debug << "QGraphicsItem";
11235 debug << '(' << static_cast<const void *>(item);
11236 if (const QGraphicsProxyWidget *pw = qgraphicsitem_cast<const QGraphicsProxyWidget *>(item)) {
11237 debug << ", widget=";
11238 if (const QWidget *w = pw->widget()) {
11239 debug << w->metaObject()->className() << '(' << static_cast<const void *>(w);
11240 if (!w->objectName().isEmpty())
11241 debug << ", name=" << w->objectName();
11242 debug << ')';
11243 } else {
11244 debug << "QWidget(0)";
11245 }
11246 }
11247 formatGraphicsItemHelper(debug, item);
11248 debug << ')';
11249 return debug;
11250}
11251
11252QDebug operator<<(QDebug debug, const QGraphicsObject *item)
11253{
11254 QDebugStateSaver saver(debug);
11255 debug.nospace();
11256
11257 if (!item) {
11258 debug << "QGraphicsObject(0)";
11259 return debug;
11260 }
11261
11262 debug << item->metaObject()->className() << '(' << static_cast<const void *>(item);
11263 if (!item->objectName().isEmpty())
11264 debug << ", name=" << item->objectName();
11265 formatGraphicsItemHelper(debug, item);
11266 debug << ')';
11267 return debug;
11268}
11269
11270QDebug operator<<(QDebug debug, QGraphicsItem::GraphicsItemChange change)
11271{
11272 const char *str = "UnknownChange";
11273 switch (change) {
11274 case QGraphicsItem::ItemChildAddedChange:
11275 str = "ItemChildAddedChange";
11276 break;
11277 case QGraphicsItem::ItemChildRemovedChange:
11278 str = "ItemChildRemovedChange";
11279 break;
11280 case QGraphicsItem::ItemCursorChange:
11281 str = "ItemCursorChange";
11282 break;
11283 case QGraphicsItem::ItemCursorHasChanged:
11284 str = "ItemCursorHasChanged";
11285 break;
11286 case QGraphicsItem::ItemEnabledChange:
11287 str = "ItemEnabledChange";
11288 break;
11289 case QGraphicsItem::ItemEnabledHasChanged:
11290 str = "ItemEnabledHasChanged";
11291 break;
11292 case QGraphicsItem::ItemFlagsChange:
11293 str = "ItemFlagsChange";
11294 break;
11295 case QGraphicsItem::ItemFlagsHaveChanged:
11296 str = "ItemFlagsHaveChanged";
11297 break;
11298 case QGraphicsItem::ItemParentChange:
11299 str = "ItemParentChange";
11300 break;
11301 case QGraphicsItem::ItemParentHasChanged:
11302 str = "ItemParentHasChanged";
11303 break;
11304 case QGraphicsItem::ItemPositionChange:
11305 str = "ItemPositionChange";
11306 break;
11307 case QGraphicsItem::ItemPositionHasChanged:
11308 str = "ItemPositionHasChanged";
11309 break;
11310 case QGraphicsItem::ItemSceneChange:
11311 str = "ItemSceneChange";
11312 break;
11313 case QGraphicsItem::ItemSceneHasChanged:
11314 str = "ItemSceneHasChanged";
11315 break;
11316 case QGraphicsItem::ItemSelectedChange:
11317 str = "ItemSelectedChange";
11318 break;
11319 case QGraphicsItem::ItemSelectedHasChanged:
11320 str = "ItemSelectedHasChanged";
11321 break;
11322 case QGraphicsItem::ItemToolTipChange:
11323 str = "ItemToolTipChange";
11324 break;
11325 case QGraphicsItem::ItemToolTipHasChanged:
11326 str = "ItemToolTipHasChanged";
11327 break;
11328 case QGraphicsItem::ItemTransformChange:
11329 str = "ItemTransformChange";
11330 break;
11331 case QGraphicsItem::ItemTransformHasChanged:
11332 str = "ItemTransformHasChanged";
11333 break;
11334 case QGraphicsItem::ItemVisibleChange:
11335 str = "ItemVisibleChange";
11336 break;
11337 case QGraphicsItem::ItemVisibleHasChanged:
11338 str = "ItemVisibleHasChanged";
11339 break;
11340 case QGraphicsItem::ItemZValueChange:
11341 str = "ItemZValueChange";
11342 break;
11343 case QGraphicsItem::ItemZValueHasChanged:
11344 str = "ItemZValueHasChanged";
11345 break;
11346 case QGraphicsItem::ItemOpacityChange:
11347 str = "ItemOpacityChange";
11348 break;
11349 case QGraphicsItem::ItemOpacityHasChanged:
11350 str = "ItemOpacityHasChanged";
11351 break;
11352 case QGraphicsItem::ItemScenePositionHasChanged:
11353 str = "ItemScenePositionHasChanged";
11354 break;
11355 case QGraphicsItem::ItemRotationChange:
11356 str = "ItemRotationChange";
11357 break;
11358 case QGraphicsItem::ItemRotationHasChanged:
11359 str = "ItemRotationHasChanged";
11360 break;
11361 case QGraphicsItem::ItemScaleChange:
11362 str = "ItemScaleChange";
11363 break;
11364 case QGraphicsItem::ItemScaleHasChanged:
11365 str = "ItemScaleHasChanged";
11366 break;
11367 case QGraphicsItem::ItemTransformOriginPointChange:
11368 str = "ItemTransformOriginPointChange";
11369 break;
11370 case QGraphicsItem::ItemTransformOriginPointHasChanged:
11371 str = "ItemTransformOriginPointHasChanged";
11372 break;
11373 }
11374 debug << str;
11375 return debug;
11376}
11377
11378QDebug operator<<(QDebug debug, QGraphicsItem::GraphicsItemFlag flag)
11379{
11380 const char *str = "UnknownFlag";
11381 switch (flag) {
11382 case QGraphicsItem::ItemIsMovable:
11383 str = "ItemIsMovable";
11384 break;
11385 case QGraphicsItem::ItemIsSelectable:
11386 str = "ItemIsSelectable";
11387 break;
11388 case QGraphicsItem::ItemIsFocusable:
11389 str = "ItemIsFocusable";
11390 break;
11391 case QGraphicsItem::ItemClipsToShape:
11392 str = "ItemClipsToShape";
11393 break;
11394 case QGraphicsItem::ItemClipsChildrenToShape:
11395 str = "ItemClipsChildrenToShape";
11396 break;
11397 case QGraphicsItem::ItemIgnoresTransformations:
11398 str = "ItemIgnoresTransformations";
11399 break;
11400 case QGraphicsItem::ItemIgnoresParentOpacity:
11401 str = "ItemIgnoresParentOpacity";
11402 break;
11403 case QGraphicsItem::ItemDoesntPropagateOpacityToChildren:
11404 str = "ItemDoesntPropagateOpacityToChildren";
11405 break;
11406 case QGraphicsItem::ItemStacksBehindParent:
11407 str = "ItemStacksBehindParent";
11408 break;
11409 case QGraphicsItem::ItemUsesExtendedStyleOption:
11410 str = "ItemUsesExtendedStyleOption";
11411 break;
11412 case QGraphicsItem::ItemHasNoContents:
11413 str = "ItemHasNoContents";
11414 break;
11415 case QGraphicsItem::ItemSendsGeometryChanges:
11416 str = "ItemSendsGeometryChanges";
11417 break;
11418 case QGraphicsItem::ItemAcceptsInputMethod:
11419 str = "ItemAcceptsInputMethod";
11420 break;
11421 case QGraphicsItem::ItemNegativeZStacksBehindParent:
11422 str = "ItemNegativeZStacksBehindParent";
11423 break;
11424 case QGraphicsItem::ItemIsPanel:
11425 str = "ItemIsPanel";
11426 break;
11427 case QGraphicsItem::ItemIsFocusScope:
11428 str = "ItemIsFocusScope";
11429 break;
11430 case QGraphicsItem::ItemSendsScenePositionChanges:
11431 str = "ItemSendsScenePositionChanges";
11432 break;
11433 case QGraphicsItem::ItemStopsClickFocusPropagation:
11434 str = "ItemStopsClickFocusPropagation";
11435 break;
11436 case QGraphicsItem::ItemStopsFocusHandling:
11437 str = "ItemStopsFocusHandling";
11438 break;
11439 case QGraphicsItem::ItemContainsChildrenInShape:
11440 str = "ItemContainsChildrenInShape";
11441 break;
11442 }
11443 debug << str;
11444 return debug;
11445}
11446
11447QDebug operator<<(QDebug debug, QGraphicsItem::GraphicsItemFlags flags)
11448{
11449 debug << '(';
11450 bool f = false;
11451 for (int i = 0; i < 17; ++i) {
11452 if (flags & (1 << i)) {
11453 if (f)
11454 debug << '|';
11455 f = true;
11456 debug << QGraphicsItem::GraphicsItemFlag(int(flags & (1 << i)));
11457 }
11458 }
11459 debug << ')';
11460 return debug;
11461}
11462
11463#endif
